English_Sentences: Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaaqoobaara Gibxxe gelida Israa7eela attuma naatu sunttai hagaappe kaallidi xaafettiis; eti ubbaikka bantta so asaa ekki gelidosona.

English_Sentences: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegeetinne: Roobeela, Simoona, Leewa, Yihudaa,

English_Sentences: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yisaakoora, Zaabiloona, Biniyaama,

English_Sentences: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Daana, Nifttaaleema, Gaadanne Aseera.

English_Sentences: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaaqooba zerettati muleera laappun tamma; Yooseefi kasekka Gibxxe bi uttiis.

English_Sentences: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yooseefi, a ishanttinne he yeleta ubbai haiqqiis;

English_Sentences: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: shin Israa7eela zerettai aifidosonanne keehi daridosona; he biittaa kumana gakkanaassi eti keehi corattidosona.

English_Sentences: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yooseefa erenna ooratta kawoi Gibxxe biittan denddiis.

English_Sentences: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:
Wolaitta_Sentences: I ba asaa, "Be7ite; ha Israa7eelati nuuppe keehi corattidosona.

English_Sentences: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Haayite, ane nuuni eta hiillan oiqqoos; hinna xayikko eti kaseegaappe yaa darana. Geelladan oli denddikko, eti nu morkketuura gaittidi, nuna olananne biittaa yeggidi baana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, deexo oosuwan eta tuggayana mala, eta bolli meqetti bainna kaabbota sunttidosona. Eti kawuwaayyo Piitoomanne Raamisa giyo aibakko minjjiyo katamata keexxidosona.

English_Sentences: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Gibxxeti eta un77uwaa dariyo wode, eti darii yelettidosonanne biittaa gakkidosona. Hegaa gishshau, Gibxxeti Israa7eelatau yayyidosona;

English_Sentences: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:
Wolaitta_Sentences: yayyidi etau biittaa goggidi ootissidosona.

English_Sentences: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in morter, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigour.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Wolqqaama oosuwan, siminttuwaaninne xuubiyaa meruwan, qassi shooqan oottiyo ubba qommo oosuwan, eta de7uwaa camettidosona; bantta daafurssiya ooso ubbaa qareti bainnan eta ootissidosona.

English_Sentences: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawoi Ibraawe maccaasata maaretissiya Xippaaronne Puuho giyo naa77u maccaasata hagaadan yaagiis;

English_Sentences: And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ibraawe maccaasati yeliyo wode intte maaretissiiddi, yelettidabi attuma na7a gidikko, worite; shin macca na7a gidikko paxa aggite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men children alive.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin maaretissiyaageeti Xoossau yayyidi, Gibxxe kawoi eta azazidoogaadan oottibookkona. Eti attuma naata paxa ashshidosona.

English_Sentences: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Gibxxe kawoi he maaretissiyaageeta xeesidi, "Intte aissi hagaadan oottidetii? Attuma naata aissi paxa aggi bayidetii?" yaagidi eta oichchiis.

English_Sentences: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin maaretissiyaageeti zaaridi, "Ibraawe maccaasati Gibxxe maccaasatu mala gidokkona; eti mino gidiyo gishshau, maaretissiyaageeti gakkanaappe kasetidi yeliichchoosona" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Xoossai maaretissiyaageetussi kehiis. Asaa qoodaikka gujji gujjidi biidi, kaseegaappe yaa corattiis.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi maaretissiyaageeti Xoossau yayyido gishshau, Xoossai etau eta huuphessi so asaa immiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi ba asaa ubbaa, "Ibraawetuppe yelettiya attuma na7a ubbaa Naile SHaafaa haattan olite; shin macca na7i yelettikko, paxa aggi bayite" yaagidi azaziis.

English_Sentences: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode issi Leewa qommo gidiya bitanee Leewa maccaasa issinniyo ekkiis;

English_Sentences: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
Wolaitta_Sentences: ekkin a abbe ixettada attuma na7aa yelaasu. Na7ai meraa lo77o na7a gidiyoogaa a be7ada, heezzu agina qosaasu.

English_Sentences: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin a hegaappe daruwaa qosanau danddayennaagaa erada, ceeccaappe keeshiyaa ayyo daddaasu; daddada renjjiyaaninne shidan meeshada, na7aa a giddon wottaasu; wottada Naile SHaafaa giyo haattaa doonan maqaa giddon wottaasu.

English_Sentences: And his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: A michchiyaa i haniyoobaa be7anau haahuwan eqqaasu.

English_Sentences: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river's side; and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa na7iyaa bollaa meecettanau Naile SHaafaa giyo shaafaa wodhdhaasu; i macca ashkkaratinne haattaa doonan yaa haa hemettoosona; a keeshiyaa maqaa giddon be7ada, baada ekkada yaana mala ba ashkkariyo kiittaasu;

English_Sentences: And when she had opened it, she saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.
Wolaitta_Sentences: keeshiyaa pogada, he guutta na7aa be7aasu. Be7iyo wode i yeekkees; yeekkin a ayyo qarettaasu; a, "Hagee Ibraawetu guutta naatuppe issuwaa" yaagaasu.

English_Sentences: Then said his sister to Pharaoh's daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode a michchiyaa kawuwaa na7iyo, "Neeyyo ha na7aa xanttanau Ibraawe maccaasa issinno ehaanau boo?" yaagada oichchaasu.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child's mother.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin a, "Ee, ba" yaagaasu. Yaagin na7iyaa baada, he na7aa aayyiyo ehaasu.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh's daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawuwaa na7iyaa he maccaasiyo, "Ha na7aa efaada, taayyo xanttashsha; taani neeyyo damoozaa qanxxana" yaagaasu. Yaagin maccaasiyaa na7aa efaada, xanttaasu.

English_Sentences: And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses: and she said, Because I drew him out of the water.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Na7ai diccin, kawuwaa na7eekko a ehaasu; i iyyo na7a gidiis; "Taani haattaappe a kessaas" gaidda, a Muusa sunttaasu.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an Egyptian smiting an Hebrew, one of his brethren.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee diccidi gitaa gididi, issi gallassi ba asai de7iyoosaa biis; biidi eti deexo ooso oottishin eta xeelliis. Gibxxe biittaa asa issoi a asatuppe, Ibraawetuppe issuwaa wadhdhishin be7iis.

English_Sentences: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I yaa haa xeellin, ooninne bainnaagaa be7idi, he Gibxxe bitaniyaa woriis; woridi shaaheeta giddon qottiis.

English_Sentences: And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi kiyidi, naa77u Ibraaweti warettiyaageeta be7iis. Naaqqidaagaa i, "Neeni ne lagge gidiya Ibraawiyaa aissi dechchai?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin he bitanee, "Nena nu bolli haariyaagaanne daanna ootti sunttidai oonee? Neeni he Gibxxe bitaniyaa woridoogaadan, tanakka worana qoppaiyye?" yaagiis. Muusee he wode, "Taani oottidobai erettiichchiis" yaagi qoppidi yayyiis.

English_Sentences: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi hagaa siyido wode, Muusa woranau koyiis; shin Muusee kawuwaappe baqatidi, Midiyaama biittan de7anau biis; biidi haatta ollaa doonan uttiis.

English_Sentences: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father's flock.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode Midiyaama qeese issuwaayyo laappun macca naati de7oosona; eti bantta aawaa dorssata haattaa ushshanau wonggiriyan haattaa duuqqi kunttanau yiidosona.

English_Sentences: And the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Henttanchchati yiidi macca naata yedettidosona; shin Muusee denddi eqqidi, eta ashshiisinne eta dorssata haattaa ushshiis.

English_Sentences: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon to day?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti bantta aawaa Yatirokko yiido wode, "Hachchi waani eesuwan yiidetii?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English_Sentences: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew water enough for us, and watered the flock.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin eti zaaridi, "Gibxxe biittaa asa issoi nuna henttanchchatuppe ashshiis; i nuuyyo haattaakka duuqqidi dorssaa wudiyaa ushshiis" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin i ba macca naata, "Yaatin i awan de7ii? Intte he bitaniyaa aissi aggi bayidetii? Ane a xeesidi, miyoobaa shoobbite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee he bitaniyaara yan de7anau maayiis; bitaneekka ba na7iyo Xippaaro Muuseyyo machcho oottidi immiis.

English_Sentences: And she bare him a son, and he called his name Gershom: for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xippaara attuma na7aa yelin, Muusee a, "Taani asa biittan bete gidaas" yaagiiddi, Gershshooma sunttiis.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass in process of time, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Daro laittaappe guyyiyan, Gibxxe kawoi haiqqiis. Israa7eelati bantta ailletettaappe oolidosonanne waassidosona; bantta ailletettaappe eti waassido waasoi pude Xoossaakko gakkiis.

English_Sentences: And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai eta ooliyaa siyidi, i Abrahaamaara, Yisaaqaaranne Yaaqoobaara maacetto maachchaa hassayiis.

English_Sentences: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Xoossai Israa7eelata xeellidi etau qoppiis.

English_Sentences: Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father in law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God, even to Horeb.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issi wode Muusee Midiyaama biittaa qeesiyaa, ba bolluwaa Yatiro dorssata heemmees; i he wudiyaa laaggi ekkidi bazzuwau gaxaa gakkanaashin efiis; efiidi Xoossaa deriyaa, Siinaa Deriyaa gakkiis.

English_Sentences: And the angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He sohuwan GODAA kiitanchchai buuran, eexxiya tama lacuwaa giddon ayyo beettiis; buurai taman xuugettikkokka, tamai buuraa meennaagaa Muusee be7iis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said, I will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Muusee, "Taani yaa baada, buurai aissi taman meetettennaakkonne ha oorattabaa ane be7ana" yaagidi qoppiis.

English_Sentences: And when the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I be7anau yaa biidoogaa GODAI be7iis; be7idi Xoossai buuraa giddoppe a, "Muusee! Muusee!" yaagidi xeesiis. Xeesin Muusee, "Yee!" giidi koyiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, Draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Koyin Xoossai a, "Haa shiiqoppa. Neeni eqqido biittai geeshsha gidiyo gishshau, ne tohuwan de7iya caammaa kessa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka GODAI a, "Taani ne aawaa Xoossaa, Abrahaama Xoossaa, Yisaaqa Xoossaa, Yaaqooba Xoossaa" yaagiis. Yaagin Muusee Xoossaa xeellanau yayyido gishshau, ba som77uwaa genttiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people which are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI qassikka hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani Gibxxe biittan ta asai tuggatiyo tuggaa geeshsha be7ada, eti bantta kaabbotuppe waassiyo waasuwaa siyada, taani eta waayiyaa qoppaas.

English_Sentences: And I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani eta Gibxxe biittaa asatu kushiyaappe ashshanaunne he biittaappe eta kessada, aahonne lo77o biitti ehaanau wodhdhaas. He biittai maattainne eessai goggiyo biitta; he biittan Kanaaneti, Hiiteti, Amooreti, Parzzeti, Hiiwetinne Yaabuusati ha77i de7oosona.

English_Sentences: Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me: and I have also seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha77i Israa7eelatu waasoi tana gakkiis; Gibxxe biittaa asati eta naaqqiyo naaquwaanne taani be7aas;

English_Sentences: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: hegaa gishshau, ha77i ba; ta asata, Israa7eelata Gibxxeppe kessana mala, Gibxxe kawuwaakko taani nena kiittais" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh, and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee Xoossaa, "Kawuwaakko baanaunne Israa7eelata Gibxxeppe kessanau taani oonee?" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be a token unto thee, that I have sent thee: When thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Xoossai a, "Taani nenaara gidana; qassi taani nena kiittidoogau malaatai hagaa: neeni he asaa Gibxxeppe kessido wode, ha deriyaa bollan intte Xoossau goinnana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto God, Behold, when I come unto the children of Israel, and shall say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they shall say to me, What is his name? what shall I say unto them?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Xoossaa, "Gido shin, taani Israa7eelatukko baada, eta, Intte aawatu Xoossai tana inttekko kiittiis yaagin, eti tana, A sunttai oonee? yaagidi oichchikko, he wode taani etayyo woiga yootanee?" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai Muusa, "Taani tanattennee; neeni Israa7eelatuyyo, Tanattennee inttekko tana kiittiis yaaga" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai Muusa qassi, "Neeni Israa7eelata, GODAI intte aawatu Xoossai, Abrahaama Xoossai, Yisaaqa Xoossai, Yaaqooba Xoossai, i tana inttekko kiittiis yaaga; hagee yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanau taani hassayettanau merinau ta suntta.

English_Sentences: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ba; baada Israa7eela cimata shiishshada, GODAI intte aawatu Xoossai, Abrahaama, Yisaaqanne Yaaqooba Xoossai taayyo qoncciis; qonccidi tana, "Taani inttena xomoosaas; Gibxxen intte bolli aibi oosettidaakko taani be7aas.

English_Sentences: And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, unto a land flowing with milk and honey.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani inttena Gibxxe biittaa tuggaappe kessada, pude maattainne eessai goggiyo Kanaanetu, Hiitetu, Amooretu, Parzzetu, Hiiwetunne Yaabuusatu biitti efaana ga uttaas" yaagiis yaaga.

English_Sentences: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Israa7eela cimati ne qaalaa siyana; hegaappe guyyiyan neeninne he cimati Gibxxe kawuwaakko biidi a, GODAI, Ibraawetu Xoossai, nunaara gaittiis. Ha77i nuuni heezzu gallassa ogiyaa bazzo hemetti biidi, GODAASSI, nu Xoossaassi, yarshshuwaa yarshshana mala nuna yedda yaagite.

English_Sentences: And I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Wolqqaama kushee a wolqqan yedissana xayikko, Gibxxe kawoi inttena yeddennaagaa taani erais.

English_Sentences: And I will stretch out my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani ta kushiyaa yeddada, eta giddon taani oottiyo ta malaatatu ubban Gibxxeta shocana. Hegaappe guyyiyan i inttena yeddana.

English_Sentences: And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Qassi taani Gibxxetun ha asaa sabissana; yaatobare intte kiyiyo wode kushe mela kiyekketa.

English_Sentences: But every woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ibraawe maccaasi ubbai ba Gibxxe shooreekkonne ba son de7iya Gibxxe maccaasai oona gidinkka ikko biidi, bira miishshata, worqqa miishshatanne attuma naatinne macca naati maayana maayota Immite giidi oichchana. Hegaadan oottidi intte Gibxxetu aquwaa bonqqana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses answered and said, But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, The LORD hath not appeared unto thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee, "Eti tana ammanennan ixxikko, woikko taani odiyoogaa siyennan ixxidi, GODAI neeyyo qonccibeenna giikko waanoo?" yaagidi zaariis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto him, What is that in thine hand? And he said, A rod.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a, "He ne kushiyan de7iyaagee aibee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin, "Xam77aa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from before it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a, "Ane a sa7an ola" yaagiis. Yaagin Muusee he gatimaa sa7an oliis; olin shooshsha kiyiis; yaatin, Muusee appe woxxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI a, "Ne kushiyaa yeddada, a goinaa oiqqa" yaagiis. Muusee yeddidi shooshshaa oiqqin, shooshshai a kushiyan simmidi, gatimau laamettiis.

English_Sentences: That they may believe that the LORD God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared unto thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI, "Hagee hanidoogee, ne aawatu Xoossai, Abrahaama Xoossai, Yisaaqa Xoossainne Yaaqooba Xoossai neeyyo qonccidoogaa eti ammananaassa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said furthermore unto him, Put now thine hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous as snow.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI a, "Ne kushiyaa ne shophphan naaqqa" yaagin, Muusee ba kushiyaa shophphan naaqqiis; i kessiyo wode a kushee barottidi shachchaadan booxxiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, Put thine hand into thy bosom again. And he put his hand into his bosom again; and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI a, "Ne kushiyaa ne shophphan zaarada naaqqa" yaagiis. Yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa ba shophphau zaari naaqqidi kessiyo wode, a kushee simmidi hinkko bollaa mala gidiis.

English_Sentences: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka GODAI a, "Eti nena ammanennan ixxikkonne koiro malaataa ammanennan ixxikko, naa77anttuwaa eti ammanana.

English_Sentences: And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin eti Xoossi oottiyo ha naa77u malaatata ammanana xayikko, woikko neeni odiyoogaa siyennan ixxikko, Naile SHaafaappe haattaa ekkada, mela biittan gussa; neeni shaafaappe ekkido haattai biittan suutta gidana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto the LORD, O my LORD, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: but I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee GODAA, "Abeet Godau, taani hagaappe kasekka, woikko neeni ne ashkkaraayyo haasayidoosappe simminkka taani biddaa danddayikke; taani leddaani haasayais; qassi ta inxxarssaikka lufa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto him, Who hath made man's mouth? or who maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not I the LORD?
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI a, "Asaassi doonaa medhdhidaagee oonee? A duude, woikko tulle oottiyaagee oonee? Xeelliyaagaanne qooqe oottiyai oonee? Tana GODAA gidikkinaayye?

English_Sentences: Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni ha77i ba; taani nena haasayanau maaddana; neeni gaanabaanne taani nena tamaarissana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, O my LORD, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA, "Godau, hayyanaa, hagaa oottanau hara asa kiittarkkii!" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses, and he said, Is not Aaron the Levite thy brother? I know that he can speak well. And also, behold, he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muuseyyo keehi hanqqettidi a, "Leewa gidiya ne ishaa Aaroonihoo? I lo77o haasayana danddayiyoogaa taani erais; ha77i i nenaara gaittanau yiiddi ogiyaa bollan de7ees; i nena be7iyo wode a wozanai ufaittana.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni, Yaaga; yaaga gaada ayyo odana; taani inttena naa77aakka haasayanau maaddananne intte oottanabaa tamaarissana.

English_Sentences: And he shall be thy spokesman unto the people: and he shall be, even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou shalt be to him instead of God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I asaayyo ne gishshaa haasayana; hegeenne, i neeyyo doonaa mala gidin, neeni ayyo Xoossa mala gidana giyoogaa.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt take this rod in thine hand, wherewith thou shalt do signs.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin ooratta malaatata an oottanau, neeni ha gatimaa ekkada ba" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses went and returned to Jethro his father in law, and said unto him, Let me go, I pray thee, and return unto my brethren which are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee ba bolluwaa Yatirokko simmi biidi, "Hanno gakkanaassi paxa de7iya asi de7ikko be7anau, taani guyye ta asaakko Gibxxe boo?" yaagiis. Yaagin Yatiroi Muusa, "Ee ba; saro gakka" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt: for all the men are dead which sought thy life.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Midiyaama biittan de7ishin GODAI a, "Nena woranau koyida asati ubbai haiqqiichchido gishshau, guyye Gibxxe biitti simmada ba" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses took his wife and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt: and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba keettaayyiyoonne ba attuma naata hariyaa togissi ekkidi, guyye Gibxxe simettaa doommiis; Muusee Xoossaa gatimaa ba kushiyan oiqqidi biis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, When thou goest to return into Egypt, see that thou do all those wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in thine hand: but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Neeni Gibxxe simmada biyo wode, taani neeyyo immido wolqqan neeni oottana malaatata ubbaa Gibxxe kawuwaa sinttan neeni oottanaagaa baloppa. Yaaninkka asaa i yeddenna mala, taani a wozanaa dammissana.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt say unto Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD, Israel is my son, even my firstborn:
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode taani GODAI giyoobaa kawuwaassi hagaadan yaagada oda; "Israa7eeli ta baira na7aa.

English_Sentences: And I say unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I taayyo goinnana mala, ta na7aa neeni yeddana mala, taani neeyyo yootaas; shin neeni a yeddennan ixxadasa; hegaa gishshau, taani ne baira attuma na7aa worana" yaagees yaagada oda" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the LORD met him, and sought to kill him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ogiyan shemppiyoosan GODAI Muuseera gaittiis; gaittidi a worana haniis.

English_Sentences: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet, and said, Surely a bloody husband art thou to me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: A keettaayyiyaa Xippaara saluwaa ekkada, ba na7aa qaxxaraasu. Qaxxarada he shoohuwan Muuse tohuwaa bochchaasu. A Muusa, "Neeni taayyo tumu suutta bullachchaawaa" yaagaasu.

English_Sentences: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI hegaa gishshau a worennan aggiis. He wode qaxxaraa malaatanau a, "Neeni taayyo suutta bullachchaawaa" yaagaasu.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went, and met him in the mount of God, and kissed him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Aaroona, "Neeni Muuseera gaittanau bazzo ba" yaagiis. Yaagin i biidi, Muuseera Xoossaa deriyan gaittidi a yeriis.

English_Sentences: And Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him, and all the signs which he had commanded him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee GODAI ba bolli kiittido qaala ubbaanne oottana mala, bana azazido ooratta malaatatubaa ubbaa Aaroonayyo yootiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni biidi, Israa7eelatu cimata ubbaa shiishshidosona.

English_Sentences: And Aaron spake all the words which the LORD had spoken unto Moses, and did the signs in the sight of the people.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHiishshin Aarooni GODAI Muuseyyo yootido qaala ubbaa etayyo odiis. Qassi Muusee malaatata he asaa sinttan oottiis.

English_Sentences: And the people believed: and when they heard that the LORD had visited the children of Israel, and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshipped.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Etikka ammanidosona. GODAI etau qoppidoogaanne eta tuggaa be7idoogaa siyido wode, eti gufannidi goinnidosona.

English_Sentences: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in, and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muuseenne Aarooni Gibxxe kawuwaakko yiidi a, "GODAI, Israa7eela Xoossai hagaadan yaagees; Ta asai taayyo bazzon baalaa bonchchana mala, eta yedda yaagees" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh said, Who is the LORD, that I should obey his voice to let Israel go? I know not the LORD, neither will I let Israel go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin kawoi, "Taani ayyo azazettada Israa7eela yeddanau he GODAI oonee? Taani GODAA erikke; Israa7eelakka yeddikke" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan eti, "Ibraawetu Xoossai nunaara gaittiis. Ha77i nuuni GODAAYYO, nu Xoossaayyo, yarshshuwaa yarshshanau heezzu gallassa ogiyaa bazzo giddo baanau nuna yeddarkkii; hinna xayikko, i nuna boshan woikko olan worana" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, let the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Gibxxe kawoi yaagiis; "Muusee! Aaroonaa! Asaa aissi oosuwaa diggeetii? Intte oosuwau simmidi biite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land now are many, and ye make them rest from their burdens.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi he wode, "Be7ite, ha biittan asai corattiis; qassi intte eta oosuwaa diggeeta" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi he gallassi Gibxxetu kaabbotanne Israa7eelatu daguwaa sunttata azaziiddi,

English_Sentences: Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Haroodeegaadan xuubiyaa oottiyo utulaa asaayyo ehi immoppite; eti utulaa banttau bi biidi shiishshona;

English_Sentences: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: shin eti qoodan kaseegaa keena xuubiyaa medhdhidi, sheedhdhanaadan azazite; he qoodaappe pacissoppite; aissi giikko, eti azalla; eti, Nuuni nu Xoossaayyo yarshshuwaa yarshshana mala, nuna yedda yaagidi waassiyoogee hegaassa.

English_Sentences: Let there more work be laid upon the men, that they may labour therein; and let them not regard vain words.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti oosuwan sheekkana malanne worddo haasayaa siyennan aggana mala, etayyo oosuwaa deexettite" yaagidi azaziis.

English_Sentences: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, he kaabbotinne he sunttati kiyidi asaa, "Kawoi hagaadan yaagees; Simmi taani intteyyo mulekka utulaa immikke;

English_Sentences: Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your work shall be diminished.
Wolaitta_Sentences: intte utulaa demmana danddayiyoosaappe intte huuphen shiishshite; shin intte sheedhdhiyo xuubiyaa qoodai mulekka paccenna yaagiis" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin asai utulaassi haniyaabaa shiishshanau Gibxxe biitta ubban laalettiis.

English_Sentences: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Fulfil your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxetu kaabboti eta, "Intteyyo utulaa immiyo wode intte hachchi hachchi oottiyoogaa keenaa oottite" yaagidi eta godatidosona.

English_Sentences: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day, as heretofore?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxetu kaabboti Israa7eelatu daguwaa sunttata wadhdhidi, "Intte kase oottiyoogaa keena xuubiyaa zino woikko hachchi aissi ootti wurssibeekketii?" yaagidi oichchidosona.

English_Sentences: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Israa7eela sunttati biidi kawuwaayyo magannidosona; eti a, "Neeni ne ashkkarata hagaadan aissi oottai?

English_Sentences: There is no straw given unto thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, thy servants are beaten; but the fault is in thine own people.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne ashkkaratuyyo utulaa immokkona; shin, Xuubiyaa medhdhite yaagoosona; yaagidi nuna ne ashkkarata wadhdhoosona; shin balai ne asaa bollaana" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: But he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle: therefore ye say, Let us go and do sacrifice to the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin kawoi eta, "Ha azallati! Intte azalla! Hegaa gishshau, intte zaari zaaridi, Nuuni GODAAYYO yarshshana baanau nuna yedda yaageeta.

English_Sentences: Go therefore now, and work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the tale of bricks.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha77i biite; biidi oottite; eti intteyyo aiba utulakka immokkona; shin intte kaseegaa keena xuubiyaakka medhdheeta" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the officers of the children of Israel did see that they were in evil case, after it was said, Ye shall not minish ought from your bricks of your daily task.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israa7eelatu sunttati, "Intte hachchi hachchi medhdhiyo xuubiyaa qoodaa kaseegaappe pacissoppite" giido wode, eti metuwan gelidoogaa akeekidosona.

English_Sentences: And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti kawuwaa matappe kiyiiddi, Muuseenne Aarooni etaara gaittanau naagiyaageeta demmidosona.

English_Sentences: And they said unto them, The LORD look upon you, and judge; because ye have made our savour to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti, "Inttena GODAI xeello! Intte bolli i pirddo! Intte nuna kawuwaaninne a oosanchchatun ixissideta; qassi eti nuna worana mala, bisuwaa eta kushiyan wottideta" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses returned unto the LORD, and said, LORD, wherefore hast thou so evil entreated this people? why is it that thou hast sent me?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee GODAAKKO simmidi, "Godau, neeni ha asaa bolli metuwaa aissi ehaadii? Neeni tana kiittidoi hagaassee?

English_Sentences: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath done evil to this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani ne sunttan kawuwaayyo haasayanau biido wodeesappe doommin, i ha asaa bolli metuwaa ehiis. Qassi neenikka ne asaa mule ashshabaakka" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Taani Gibxxe kawuwaa oottanabaa neeni ha77i be7ana; ta wolqqaama kushiyaa gaasuwan i eta yeddana; ta wolqqaama kushiyaa gaasuwan i eta ba biittaappe laaggidi kessana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And God spake unto Moses, and said unto him, I am the LORD:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai qassikka Muusa, "Taani GODAA;

English_Sentences: And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name JEHOVAH was I not known to them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani Abrahaamayyo, Yisaaqayyoonne Yaaqoobayyo Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa gidada qonccaas; shin taani, GODAA giyo ta sunttan, tanatettaa eta erissabeikke.

English_Sentences: And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi taani etayyo eti bete gididi de7ido Kanaane biittaa immanau ta maachchaa etaara maacettaas.

English_Sentences: And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage; and I have remembered my covenant.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka Gibxxe asati ailleyiyo Israa7eelatu ooliyaa taani siyada, ta maachchaa hassayaas.

English_Sentences: Wherefore say unto the children of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm, and with great judgments:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, neeni Israa7eelata, Taani GODAA; taani inttena Gibxxetu naaquwaappe kessana; taani inttena eta ailletettaappekka goqa kessana; qassi taani inttena ta gita wolqqaaninne hanttaara pirddan wozana.

English_Sentences: And I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, which bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani inttena ta huuphe asadan ekkananne taani intte Xoossaa gidana. He wode intte taani GODAA intte Xoossaa inttena Gibxxetu ailletettaappe kessidaagaa gidiyoogaa erana.

English_Sentences: And I will bring you in unto the land, concerning the which I did swear to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it you for an heritage: I am the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi taani inttena Abrahaamayyo, Yisaaqayyoonne Yaaqoobayyo immanau ta kushiyaa denttada caaqqido biittau ehaana; he biittaa taani intteyyo intte gade oottada immana; taani GODAA yaaga" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses spake so unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee hagaa Israa7eelatuyyo yootiis; shin eta heennai meqqido gaasuwaaninne meqetti bainna ailletettaa gaasuwan a qaalaa siyibookkona.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa,

English_Sentences: Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ba; baada Gibxxe kawuwaa, Israa7eelata ne biittaappe kessada yedda yaagada yoota" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses spake before the LORD, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA, "Israa7eelati tabaa siyennan ixxaappe attin, taani deddotiya inxxarssan haasayiyoogaa kawoi aissi siyii?" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona, "Biite; biidi, intte Israa7eela asaa Gibxxeppe kessana mala, taani inttena yeddidoogaa Israa7eela asaassinne Gibxxe kawuwaassi yootite" yaagidi azaziis.

English_Sentences: These be the heads of their fathers' houses: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel; Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these be the families of Reuben.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eta so asatu halaqati hageeta. Israa7eelayyo baira na7aa Roobeela attuma naati, Heenooka, Paalu, Hexiroonanne Karmma; hageeti Roobeela yarata.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Simoona attuma naati, Yimu7eela, Yaamiina, Ohaada, Yaakiina, Xoohaaranne Kanaane biittaa maccaaseeppe yelettida SHaa7ula; hageeti usuppunati Simoona yarata.

English_Sentences: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations; Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari: and the years of the life of Levi were an hundred thirty and seven years.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Leewa attuma naati bantta yeletaa maaraadan Gershshoona, Qahaatanne Maraara. Leewi xeetanne hasttamanne laappun laittaa de7iis.

English_Sentences: The sons of Gershon; Libni, and Shimi, according to their families.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gershshoona attuma naati bantta yaran yaran Liibinanne SHim77a geetettoosona.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Kohath; Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel: and the years of the life of Kohath were an hundred thirty and three years.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qahaata attuma naati Amiraama, Yixihaara, Kebroonanne Uzzi7eela. Qahaati xeetanne hasttamanne heezzu laitta de7iis.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Merari; Mahali and Mushi: these are the families of Levi according to their generations.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Maraara attuma naati Maahilanne Musha giyoogeeta. Bantta Yeletaa maaran Leewa yarati hageeta.

English_Sentences: And Amram took him Jochebed his father's sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram were an hundred and thirty and seven years.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Amiraami ba aawaa michchiyo Yokebeedo machchiis. A Aaroonanne Muusa ayyo yelaasu. Amiraami xeetanne hasttamanne laappun laittaa de7iis.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yixihaara attuma naati, Qoraaha, Nefeganne Ziikira.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Uzziel; Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Uzzi7eela attuma naati, Mishaa7eela, Elxxaafaananne Siitira.

English_Sentences: And Aaron took him Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, to wife; and she bare him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aarooni Aminadaaba na7iyo, Na7asoona michchiyo Elisheebo machchiis. Yaatin a ayyo Nadaaba, Abiiha, El77aazaranne Itaamaara yelaasu.

English_Sentences: And the sons of Korah; Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korhites.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qore attuma naati, Asiira, Elqqaananne Abiyaasaafa; hageeti Qore yaratu maizza aawata.

English_Sentences: And Eleazar Aaron's son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bare him Phinehas: these are the heads of the fathers of the Levites according to their families.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aaroona na7ai El77aazari Puti7eela naatuppe issinno machchiis; a ayyo Piinihaasa yelaasu. Hageeti bantta yaran yaran Leewatu keettaa asaa halaqata.

English_Sentences: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI, "Gibxxe biittaappe Israa7eelata eta citan citan kessite" yaagidoi ha Muusanne ha Aaroona.

English_Sentences: These are they which spake to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israa7eelata Gibxxe biittaappe kessiyoogaa Gibxxe kawuwaassi haasayidaageeti eta. Hageeti he Muusanne he Aaroona.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass on the day when the LORD spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Gibxxen Muuseyyo haasayido wode a,

English_Sentences: That the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, I am the LORD: speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say unto thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Taani GODAA; taani neeyyo yootiyoobaa ubbaa neeni Gibxxe kawuwaayyo yoota" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA, "Taani deddotiya inxxarssan haasayiyaagaa gidishin, kawoi taani yootiyoobaa waati siyanee?" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, See, I have made thee a god to Pharaoh: and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Be7a; taani nena Gibxxe kawuwaayyo Xoossa mala oottaas; ne ishai Aarooni ne hananabaa yootiyaagaa gidana;

English_Sentences: Thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he send the children of Israel out of his land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani nena azazido ubbaa neeni ayyo yootaasa; ne ishaa Aarooni Israa7eelata ba biittaappe kessi yeddana mala, kawuwaayyo yootees.

English_Sentences: And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin taani kawuwaa wozanaa dammissana; taani Gibxxe biittan ta ooratta malaataanne maalaalissiyaabaa darissada oottikkokka,

English_Sentences: But Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that I may lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth mine armies, and my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
Wolaitta_Sentences: i intte yootiyoobaa siyenna. He wode taani ta kushiyaa Gibxxetu bolli denttana; taani ta citaa, ta asaa Israa7eela wolqqaama pirddan Gibxxeppe kessana.

English_Sentences: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch forth mine hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi Gibxxeti, taani ta kushiyaa Gibxxe bolli denttada, Israa7eelata eta giddoppe kessido wode, taani GODAA gidiyoogaa eti erana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron did as the LORD commanded them, so did they.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni likke GODAI eta azazidoogaadan oottidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spake unto Pharaoh.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti kawuwaayyo yootiyo wode, Muusee hosppun tammu laitta asa; Aarooni qassi hosppun tammanne heezzu laitta asa.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona hagaadan yaagiis;

English_Sentences: When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, Shew a miracle for you: then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it before Pharaoh, and it shall become a serpent.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Kawoi inttena, Xoossai oottiyo malaataa tana bessite giyo wode, neeni Aaroona, Ne gatimaa ekkada, kawuwaa sinttan ola yaaga; yaatobare i shooshsha kiyana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so as the LORD had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh, and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muuseenne Aarooni kawuwaakko gelidosona; gelidi likke GODAI eta azazidoogaadan oottidosona; Aarooni ba gatimaa kawuwaa sinttaaninne a oosanchchatu sinttan oliis; olin shooshsha kiyiis.

English_Sentences: Then Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers: now the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi aadhdhida eranchchatanne bitanchchata xeesissiis; xeesissin etikka, ha Gibxxetu shareechchoti bantta eeqan hegaadan oottidosona.

English_Sentences: For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron's rod swallowed up their rods.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti ubbaikka bantta gatimaa gatimaa olin, gatimati shooshsha kiyidosona; shin Aaroona gatimai eta gatimata mitti bayiis.

English_Sentences: And he hardened Pharaoh's heart, that he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gidikkonne GODAI yootidoogaadankka kawuwaa wozanai dammiis; i eta oduwaa siyennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh's heart is hardened, he refuseth to let the people go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Kawuwaa wozanai dammiis; asaa i yeddennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river's brink against he come; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi haattau biyo wode, guurada neeni akko ba; baada aara gaittanau neeni Naile SHaafaa doonan eqqa; shooshshau laamettida gatimaa oiqqa ekkada ba.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni a, GODAI, Ibraawetu Xoossai nena, "Bazzuwan taayyo goinnana mala, ta asaa yedda" yaagidi, tana neekko kiittiis; shin hanno gakkanaashin neeni siyabaakka.

English_Sentences: Thus saith the LORD, In this thou shalt know that I am the LORD: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI, "Taani GODAA gidiyoogaa neeni hagan erana" yaagees. Taani Naile SHaafaa haattaa ta kushiyan de7iya gatiman shocana; shocin haattai suuttau laamettana.

English_Sentences: And the fish that is in the river shall die, and the river shall stink; and the Egyptians shall lothe to drink of the water of the river.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Naile SHaafaa moleekka haiqqana; shaafaikka xinqqana; Gibxxeti he shaafaa haattaa uyanau danddayokkona yaagada oda" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thine hand upon the waters of Egypt, upon their streams, upon their rivers, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pools of water, that they may become blood; and that there may be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and in vessels of stone.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa hagaadan yaagiis; "Neeni Aaroona, Ne gatimaa oiqqada Gibxxe haattatu bolli, shaafatu bolli, zara haattatu bolli, dalbbanttatu bollinne haattaa dagayiyoobatu ubbaa bolli ne kushiyaa micca yaaga; i miccin eti suuttau laamettana; Gibxxe biitta ubban, harai attin, mittaappenne shuchchaappe woocidi kessido haattaa tigiyo miishshatu ubban suutti kumana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni GODAI azazidoogaadan oottidosona. Kawuwaa sinttaaninne a sunttatu sinttan i ba gatimaa denttidi, abbaa haattaa shociis; shocin haatta ubbai suuttau laamettiis.

English_Sentences: And the fish that was in the river died; and the river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river; and there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He abbaa haattaa giddon de7iya moleti haiqqidosona; shaafaa haattai keehi zeeqqido gishshau, Gibxxe asai uyanau danddayibeenna. Gibxxen mule ubbasan suuttai kumiis.

English_Sentences: And the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments: and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, neither did he hearken unto them; as the LORD had said.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Gibxxe shareechchoti bantta eeqan hegaadan oottidosona; GODAI yootidoogaadankka kawuwaa wozanai dammin, Muuseenne Aarooni odidoogaa siyennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he set his heart to this also.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi hagau ainne hirggennan ba soo simmidi biis.

English_Sentences: And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe asai ubbai Naile SHaafaa haattaa uyanau danddayibeenna gishshau, uyiyo haatta demmanau Naile SHaafaa lanqqiyan ollaa bookkidosona.

English_Sentences: And seven days were fulfilled, after that the LORD had smitten the river.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI haattaa shocoosappe laappun gallassa gidiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Go unto Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Ba; Gibxxe kawuwaakko baada, GODAI hagaadan yaagees; "Taayyo goinnana mala, ta asaa yedda.

English_Sentences: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni eta yeddennan ixxikko, taani ne biitta ubban shodhdhiyaa boshaa yeddana.

English_Sentences: And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneadingtroughs:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Naile SHaafan shodhdhee shohattana. Eti shohatti kiyidi ne soo, ne siirixaa, ne arssaa giddo, ne sunttatu keettaa giddo gelana; ne asaa bolli kiyana; ne coociyaanne ne munaqa keretun gelana.

English_Sentences: And the frogs shall come up both on thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHodhdheti ne bolli, ne asaa bollinne ne sunttatu ubbaa bolli kiyana" yaagees yaagada oda" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thine hand with thy rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Neeni Aaroona, Ne gatimaa oiqqada, shaafatu bolli, zara haattatu bollinne dalbbanttatu bolli ne kushiyaa micca; miccada shodhdheti Gibxxe biittaa bollan kiyanaadan ootta yaagada yoota" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Aarooni Gibxxe haattatu bolli ba kushiyaa micciis; miccin shodhdheti kiyidi, Gibxxe biittaa maayidosona.

English_Sentences: And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin shareechchotikka bantta eeqan hegaadan oottidosona; etikka Gibxxe biittan shodhdhee kiyanaadan oottidosona.

English_Sentences: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Intreat the LORD, that he may take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may do sacrifice unto the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi Muusanne Aaroona xeesissidi, "Ha shodhdheta taappenne ta asaappe diggana mala, GODAA intte woossite; yaanikko GODAASSI yarshshuwaa yarshshana mala, taani asaa yeddana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Glory over me: when shall I intreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee and thy houses, that they may remain in the river only?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee kawuwaa, "SHodhdheti neeppenne ne sooppe xayana malanne Naile SHaafaa xalaalan attana mala, taani neeyyo, ne sunttatuyyoonne ne asaayyo woossana wodiyaa neeni keera" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And he said, To morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word: that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the LORD our God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin kawoi, "Wontto" yaagiis. Yaagin Muusee, "Nu GODAA Xoossaa malai ooninne bainnaagaa neeni erana mala, neeni giidoogaadan hanana.

English_Sentences: And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He shodhdheti neeppe, ne keettaappe, ne sunttatuppenne ne asaappe xayana; eti Naile SHaafaa xalaalan attana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto the LORD because of the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni kawuwaa matappe kiyidosona; kawuwaa bolli Muusee ehiido shodhdhetubaa Muusee GODAAYYO woossiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Woossin GODAI Muusee oichchidoogaadan oottiis; shodhdheti son kareeninne dembban haiqqidosona.

English_Sentences: And they gathered them together upon heaps: and the land stank.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe asai eta shiishshi shiishshidi dooridosona; biittainne hegaa xinqquwan zeeqqiis.

English_Sentences: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin kawoi peeqaa demmido wode a wozanai dammiis; GODAI yootidoogaadankka, i Muuseenne Aarooni odido oduwaa siyennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the land, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI hegaappe guyyiyan, Muusa hagaadan yaagiis; "Neeni Aaroona, Ne gatimaa miccada, biittaa buhiyaa shoca yaaga; shocin Gibxxe biitta ubban buhee cuuchcha kiyana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And they did so; for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and it became lice in man, and in beast; all the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin eti hegaadan oottidosona; Aarooni gatimaa oiqqidi ba kushiyaa micciis; ba gatiman biittaa buhiyaa shociis; shocin asaa, mehiyaanne do7aa bolli cuuchchai yi bayiis. Gibxxe biittan ha gaxaappe ya gaxaa gakkanaashin, buhe ubbai cuuchcha kiyiis.

English_Sentences: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man, and upon beast.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHareechchotikka bantta eeqan hegaadan oottanau mali be7idosona; shin danddayibookkona. Cuuchchai asaa bollan, mehiyaa bollaaninne do7aa bollan kumiis.

English_Sentences: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHareechchoti kawuwaa, "Hagee Xoossaa ooso" yaagidosona. SHin kawuwaa wozanai dammiis; GODAI giidoogaadankka, i eti odiyoobaa siyennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Guurada denddada, kawoi shaafaa biishin aara gaitta; gaittada neeni a, GODAI yaagees; "Taayyo oottana mala, ta asaa yedda;

English_Sentences: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
Wolaitta_Sentences: neeni ta asaa yeddennan ixxikko, taani ne bolli, ne sunttatu bolli, ne asaa bollinne ne keettatu giddo gawwiina udunxxiyaa yeddana; Gibxxetu keettaaninne eti de7iyo biitta ubban udunxxee kumana.

English_Sentences: And I will sever in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin he gallassi ta asai de7iyo Goshena biittan udunxxee gawwattennaadan taani teqqada, eta biittaa zaggana; taani GODAI, ha biittan de7iyoogaa neeni hegan erana.

English_Sentences: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to morrow shall this sign be.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani ta asaanne ne asaa zaggana; ha gita malaatai wontto hanana" yaagees yaagada oda" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD did so; and there came a grievous swarm of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants' houses, and into all the land of Egypt: the land was corrupted by reason of the swarm of flies.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI hegaappe guyyiyan, giidoogaadan oottiis; kawuwaa sooninne a sunttatu son daro gawwiina udunxxee yiis; yiidi Gibxxe biittaa ubbaa bashshiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode kawoi Muusanne Aaroona xeesissidi, "Biite; ha biittan intte Xoossaassi yarshshite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God: lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muuse, "Hegee likke gidenna; nuuni GODAA nu Xoossaassi shiishshiyo yarshshoti Gibxxeta sheneyiyaabaa gidana; nuuni eta sheneyiya yarshshota eti xeellishin yarshshikko, eti nuna shuchchan caddokkonaa?

English_Sentences: We will go three days' journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God, as he shall command us.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Nuuni GODAASSI, nu Xoossaassi, yarshshota shiishshanau i nuna azaziyoogaadan, heezzu gallassa ogiyaa bazzuwaa baana koshshees" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: intreat for me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin kawoi, "GODAASSI, intte Xoossaassi, intte bazzuwaa biidi yarshshana mala, taani inttena yeddana; shin intte haakkidi booppite; taayyo ha77i woossite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will intreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to morrow: but let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee, "Taani ne matappe kiyosaarakka GODAA woossana; ha gawwiina udunxxee wontto kawuwaappe, a sunttatuppenne a asaappe kichchana. SHin GODAAYYO yarshshanau asaa yeddennan ixxanau kawoi nuna zaari cimmenna mala akeeko" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and intreated the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee kawuwaa matappe kiyidi, GODAA woossiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Woossin GODAI Muusee oichchidoogaadan oottiis; udunxxee kawuwaappe, a sunttatuppenne a asaappe issoinne attennan kichchiis.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, neither would he let the people go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin ha77ikka qassi kawuwaa wozanai dammin, asaa yeddennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa hagaadan yaagiis; "Ba; Gibxxe kawuwaakko baada, GODAI, Ibraawetu Xoossai nena, "Eti taayyo goinnana mala ta asaa yedda" yaagees.

English_Sentences: For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni yeddennan ixxada, eta oiqqa uttiyaabaa gidikko,

English_Sentences: Behold, the hand of the LORD is upon thy cattle which is in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani deriyan de7iya ne mehiyaa bolli, paratu bolli, haretu bolli, gaameelatu bolli, miizzatu bolli, dorssatu bollinne deeshshatu bolli hanttaara boshaa yeggana.

English_Sentences: And the LORD shall sever between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt: and there shall nothing die of all that is the children's of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin taani GODAI Israa7eela mehetu gidduwaaninne Gibxxetu mehetu gidduwan zagaa medhdhana. Israa7eelatu mehiyaappe issoinne haiqqenna yaaga" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD appointed a set time, saying, To morrow the LORD shall do this thing in the land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI wodiyaa keeridi, "Taani wontto hagaa ha biittaa bollan oottana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagidi wonttetta gallassi GODAI hegaa oottiis. Gibxxe asaa mehe ubbai haiqqiis; shin Israa7eela asaa mehiyaappe issoinne haiqqibeenna.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people go.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi ha yohuwaa paaccanau asa kiittidi, Israa7eelatu mehiyaappe, harai atto, issoinne haiqqibeennaagaa eriis. Gidikkonne kawuwaa wozanai dammidosaappe simmennan ixxin, asaa yeddennan diggiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI hegaappe guyyiyan, Muusanne Aaroona, "Intte kushiyaa kunttidi coociyaappe bidinttaa kuuccite; kuuccidi Muusee kawoi xeellishin, hegaa pude carkkuwau laalo;

English_Sentences: And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: hegee Gibxxe biitta ubbaa bolli liiqo buhe gidana; Gibxxe biitta ubban asaa bollinne mehiyaa bolli giiyyiya merkkoi wodhdhana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin eti coociyaappe bidinttaa ekkidi, kawuwaa sinttan eqqidosona; Muusee hegaa pude carkkuwan laalin, asaa bollinne mehiyaa bolli giiyiya merkkoi wodhdhi bayiis.

English_Sentences: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHareechchotikka eta bollinne Gibxxe asaa ubbaa bolli wodhdhida merkkoi esuwaa diggin, Muuse sinttan eqqanau danddayibookkona.

English_Sentences: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken unto Moses.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin GODAI Muusessi giidoogaadankka, kawuwaa wozanaa dammissido gishshau, Muuseenne Aarooni yootiyoogaa kawoi siyennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Guuran denddada baada, kawuwaara gaitta; gaittada a, GODAI, Ibraawetu Xoossai nena, "Taayyo goinnana mala ta asaa yedda.

English_Sentences: For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thine heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hinna xayikko, ne bolli, ne sunttatu bollinne ne asaa bolli ta boshaayyo de7iya kumetta wolqqaa taani kiittana; biittan sa7an ta mali bainnaagaa neeni hegan erana.

English_Sentences: For now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani hannoode ta kushiyaa yeddada, nenanne ne asaa boshan ha sa7aa bollappe mulluccu oottargganashin.

English_Sentences: And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, for to shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani nena ta wolqqaa bessanaunne ta sunttai sa7a ubbaa bollan odettanau, hegau taani nena paxa wottaas.

English_Sentences: As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni ha77ikka otorettada, ta asaa yeddennan ixxadasa.

English_Sentences: Behold, to morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani wontto hannoode Gibxxee Gibxxe gidoosappe hachchi gakkanaassi mulekka wodhdhi erenna, keehippe gita shachchaa yeggana.

English_Sentences: Send therefore now, and gather thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field; for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha77i neeni ne mehiyaanne gaden neeyyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa eesuwan soo gelissanaadan azaza; aissi giikko, soo geliichchennan biron gaden de7iya asa ubbaa bollinne mehe ubbaa bolli shachchai wodhdhana; wodhdhin eti haiqqana" yaagees yaaga" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: He that feared the word of the LORD among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawuwaa sunttatuppe GODAA qaalaayyo yayyidaageeti bantta ailletanne bantta mehiyaa eesotidi soo gelissidosona.

English_Sentences: And he that regarded not the word of the LORD left his servants and his cattle in the field.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin GODAA qaalaa karidaageeti bantta ailletanne bantta mehiyaa gaden aggi bayidosona.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Gibxxe biitta ubbaa bollan: asa bolli, mehiyaa bollinne Gibxxe goshshatun dicciyaabaa ubbaa bolli shachchai wodhdhanaadan, ne kushiyaa saluwaa dentta" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee ba gatimaa saluwaa zaaridi denttido wode, GODAI dadaanne shachchaa yeddiis; wolqqanttainne duge sa7au wolqqammiis. GODAI Gibxxe biittan shachchaa yaati bukissiis.

English_Sentences: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHachchai wodhdhiis; wolqqanttai yaanne haanne wolqqammiis; Gibxxe biittan kawoi kawotoosappe doommin, Gibxxe biitta ubban wodhdhida shachcha ubbaappe hegee aadhdhiya iita shachcha.

English_Sentences: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He shachchai Gibxxe biitta ubban gaden de7iya ubbabaa, asaakka mehiyaakka shociis; gaden mokkidabaa ubbaa duge zaaridi diippiis; mitta ubbaa mentterettiis.

English_Sentences: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHachchi wodhdhibeenna biitti Israa7eelati uttido Goshena biittaa xalaala.

English_Sentences: And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: the LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi kiittidi Muusanne Aaroona xeesissiis; xeesissidi, "Ha77i simmi, taani nagaraa oottaas; GODAI tumanchcha; taaninne ta asai mooranchcha.

English_Sentences: Intreat the LORD (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Nuuyyo dadainne shachchai darido gishshau, GODAA woossite. Taani inttena yeddana; simmi hagaappe sinttan intte hagan takkekketa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto the LORD; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know how that the earth is the LORD's.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee a, "Taani ha katamaappe kiyido wode, taani woossanau ta kushiyaa GODAAKKO miccana; yaatobare dadai aggana; qassi shachchaa worettainne attana; sa7ai GODAABAA gidiyoogaa neeni hegan erana.

English_Sentences: But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the LORD God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin neeninne ne sunttati GODAU Xoossau ha77inne yayyennaagaa taani erais" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the flax and the barley was smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was bolled.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Talbbai ciyyido gishshaunne banggai tiyattido gishshau, talbbainne banggai shachchan bayidosona.

English_Sentences: But the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not grown up.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin gistteenne qambbarai ka77iyo wodee biroona gidido gishshau, eti shachchan bayibookkona.

English_Sentences: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto the LORD: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee kawuwaa achchappe denddidi, katamaappe gaxaa kiyiis. Kiyidi ba kushiyaa GODAAKKO micciis; yaatin dadainne shachchai caggiis; iraikka biittaa bollan duge tigettiyoogee eqqiis.

English_Sentences: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin kawoi irai, shachchainne dadai aggidoogaa be7ido wode zaaridikka nagaraa oottiis; ikka a sunttatikka bantta wozanaa dammissidosona.

English_Sentences: And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, neither would he let the children of Israel go; as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muuse doonan haasayidoogaadankka kawuwaa wozanai dammin, Israa7eelata i yeddennan ixxiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh: for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I might shew these my signs before him:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusa GODAI hagaadan yaagiis; "Gibxxe kawuwaakko ba; aissi giikko, taani Gibxxeta waata qaxxayidaakkonne ta gita malaataa eta giddon waata oottidaakko intte intte naatussinne intte naatu naatussi yootana mala,

English_Sentences: And that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son's son, what things I have wrought in Egypt, and my signs which I have done among them; that ye may know how that I am the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: qassi inttekka taani GODAA gidiyoogaa erana mala, ta gita malaataa eta giddon oottanau a wozanaanne a sunttatu wozanaa taani dammissa wottaas" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses and Aaron came in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? let my people go, that they may serve me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muuseenne Aarooni kawuwaakko gelidi a, "GODAI, Ibraawetu Xoossai nena hagaadan yaagees; Neeni taayyo azazettennan aude gakkanaassi ixxuutee? Taayyo oottana mala ta asaa yedda.

English_Sentences: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni eta yeddennan ixxikko, ne biittaa bolli taani wontto booliyaa ehaana;

English_Sentences: And they shall cover the face of the earth, that one cannot be able to see the earth: and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field:
Wolaitta_Sentences: boolee ooninne biittaa demmanau danddayennaadan biittaa kammana. Intteyyo shachchaappe attida guuttabaa, gaden dicciya mittaikka attennan ubbaa maana.

English_Sentences: And they shall fill thy houses, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; which neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers' fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day. And he turned himself, and went out from Pharaoh.
