Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi asaa ubbaa giddon danddayiya asata, Xoossaayyo yayyiyaageeta, ammanettidaageetanne mattaayiyaa miyoogaa ixxiyaageeta doora. Doorada etappe asaayyo shaalaqata, mato halaqata, hamssaalaqatanne assiraalaqata oottada suntta.

English_Sentences: And let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti ubba wode asaayyo pirddona; shin waayissiya yoho ubbaa neekko ehona; waayissenna yoho ubbaa eti wurssona. Eti nenaara shaakkiyo gishshau, toohoi neeyyo kawuyyana.

English_Sentences: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni hegaadan oottikkonne hagee Xoossaa shene gidikko, neeni danddayana. Qassi ha asai ubbaikka ba allaallee polettin, ba soo ba soo baana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law, and did all that he had said.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee ba bolluwaa qaalaa siyiis; i giidobaa ubbaakka oottiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Israa7eela ubbaa giddoppe danddayiya asata dooriis; dooridi asaa kaalettiya shaalaqata, mato halaqata, hamssaalaqatanne assiraalaqata oottidi sunttiis.

English_Sentences: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Sunttin eti asaayyo ubba wode pirddidosona; eti banttana deexxida yohuwaa Muusekko ehiidosona; shin deexxenna yoho ubbaa eti wurssidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses let his father in law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee ba bolluwaa moissiis; moissin Yatiroi ba biitti simmiis.

English_Sentences: In the third month, when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israa7eela asai Gibxxeppe kiyido heezzantta aginan koiro gallassan Siinaa bazzuwaa gakkidosona.

English_Sentences: For they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the desert of Sinai, and had pitched in the wilderness; and there Israel camped before the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Rafiidimappe denddidi Siinaa bazzuwaa biiddi, bazzon de7iya deriyau sintta baazzan uttidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Xoossaakko pude deriyaa huuphiyaa kiyin, GODAI deriyaa huuphiyan a xeesidi, "Neeni Yaaqooba keettaa hagaadan yaaga; Israa7eelau hagaadan yaagada yoota;

English_Sentences: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles' wings, and brought you unto myself.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani Gibxxetu bolli ai oottidaakkonne qassi argganttaa qefiyan taani inttena waata tookkada taakko ehiidaakkonne intte intte huuphen be7ideta.

English_Sentences: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people: for all the earth is mine:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Simmi ha77i intte taayyo kumetta azazettikkonne ta maachchaa naagikko, kawotetta ubbaa giddon intte taayyo buzo gidana. Kumetta sa7ai tabaa gidikkonne

English_Sentences: And ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and an holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: intte taayyo qeesetu kawotettanne geeshsha kawotetta gidana yaaga; neeni Israa7eelatuyyo yootana qaalai hagaa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before their faces all these words which the LORD commanded him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee guyye simmi biidi, dere cimata xeesi shiishshidi, GODAI yoota giido ha qaalata ubbaa etau yootiis.

English_Sentences: And all the people answered together, and said, All that the LORD hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Asai ubbai issi doona gididi, "GODAI giidobaa ubbaa nuuni oottana" yaagidosona. Yaagin Muuseekka eti giidoogaa GODAAKKO ekkidi efiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Taani nenaara haasayishin asai siyanaadaaninne eti nenan ubba wodekka ammanettanaadan, taani neekko sikkida shaara giddoora yaana" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee asai giidoogaa GODAAYYO yootiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to day and to morrow, and let them wash their clothes,
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Neeni asaakko ba; baada hachchinne wontto neeni eta geeshsha. Eti bantta maayuwaa meeccona;

English_Sentences: And be ready against the third day: for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
Wolaitta_Sentences: meeccidi heezzantto gallassau giigona. Aissi giikko, heezzantto gallassan asai ubbai be7ishin, GODAI Siinaa Deriyaa bollan wodhdhana.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni ha deriyaa yuushuwan asaayyo zawaa wottada etayyo, Deriyaa pude kiyennaadan woikko deriyaa xaphuwaa bochchennaadan inttena erite. Deriyaa bochchida ooninne tumuppe haiqqana.

English_Sentences: There shall not an hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He urai shuchchan cadettidi woikko wonddafiyaa zubbiyan dukettidi haiqqana; i kushen boshettenna. Mehe, woikko do7a, woikko asa gidikkonne i paxa attenna yaaga. Malkkatai tolidi waassiyo wode, he wode eti deriyaa pude kiyana giikko kiyona" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee deriyaappe asaakko duge wodhdhidoogaappe guyyiyan eta geeshshin, eti bantta maayuwaa meeccidosona.

English_Sentences: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not at your wives.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan asaa i, "Heezzantta gallassaayyo giigettite; maccaasaara aqoppite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud; so that all the people that was in the camp trembled.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Heezzantta gallassi maallado dadaa gunttai siyettiis. Wolqqanttainne sikkida shaarai deriyaa maayidi beettiis; malkkataikka punettiyo wolqqaama cenggurssai siyettiis. Hegaa gishshau, ba de7iyoosan asai ubbai kokkoriis.

English_Sentences: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee asaa Xoossaara gattanau eti de7iyo dunkkaaniyaappe kessiis; eti deriyau garssa shoobban eqqidosona.

English_Sentences: And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Siinaa Deriyaa bollan tamaara wodhdhido gishshau, Siinaa Dere ubbai cuwan kamettiis. Gita coociyaappe cuwai kiyiyoogaadan, appe cuwai zuliyaa essidi pude kiyiis. Mule deree keehippe gajigajiis.

English_Sentences: And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Malkkataa punettainne keehippe dari dari biido wode, Muusee haasayin, Xoossaa cenggurssai ayyo zaaridi haasayiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Siinaa Deriyaa kiikiyan wodhdhidi, Muusa pude deriyaayyo kiikiyau xeesiis; xeesin Muusee pude kiyiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto the LORD to gaze, and many of them perish.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kiyin GODAI a, "Neeni duge ba; baada asai GODAA be7ana giidi, zawaa kanttennaadaaninne etappe daroi haiqqennaadan asaa seera.

English_Sentences: And let the priests also, which come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves, lest the LORD break forth upon them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Harai atto GODAA mati shiiqiya qeesetikka banttana geeshshanau koshshees; hegee xayikko, GODAI eta qaxxayana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto the LORD, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee GODAA, "Asai deriyaa kiikiyaa pude yaanau danddayenna; aissi giikko, neeni ne huuphen, Ha sohuwaa geeshshadan dummayidi, ha deriyaa yuushuwan zawaa wottite gaada nuuyyo oda wottadasa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto him, Away, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the LORD, lest he break forth upon them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a, "Neeni duge ba; baada Aaroona nenaara pude ekkada ya. Qeesetanne asaa GODAI xaissennaadan, eti zawaa kanttidi pude GODAAKKO yooppona" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: So Moses went down unto the people, and spake unto them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Muusee duge asaakko wodhdhidi, GODAI giidoogaa etayyo yootiis.

English_Sentences: And God spake all these words, saying,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai ha qaalata ubbaa hagaadan yaagidi haasayiis;

English_Sentences: I am the LORD thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Nena Gibxxeppe ailletettaa biittaappe kessida GODAI ne Xoossai tanattennee.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Taappe attin, hara xoossassi goinnoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Bolla saluwan de7iyaabaa, woikko garssa sa7an de7iyaabaa, woikko sa7aappe garssan haatta giddon de7iyaabaa aibanne malatissada neeyyo goinniyo misileta kessoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;
Wolaitta_Sentences: Etayyo hokkoppa woikko etayyo goinnoppa. Aissi giikko, taani, GODAI ne Xoossai qanaatiya Xoossaa; tana ixxiyaageeta aawatu nagaraa gishshau, naata heezzantto yeletaanne oiddantto yeletaa gakkanaassi qaxxayiyaagaa.

English_Sentences: And shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi tana siiqiyaanne ta azazuwaa naagiya sha7atussi siiquwaa bessiya Xoossaa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xoossaa ne GODAA sunttaa hadan denttoppa; aissi giikko, GODAI ba sunttaa hadan denttiyaagaa qaxxayana.

English_Sentences: Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Geeshsha oottada, Sambbata gallassaa naaga.

English_Sentences: Six days shalt thou labour, and do all thy work:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni oottiyo ooso ubbaa usuppun gallassatun ootta.

English_Sentences: But the seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin laappuntta gallassai GODAAYYO, ne Xoossaayyo Sambbata. He gallassi aiba oosonne oottoppa; neeni, woikko ne attuma na7ai, woikko ne macca na7iyaa, woikko ne ashkkarai, woikko ne ashkkariyaa, woikko ne miizzai, woikko ne karen de7iya betee he gallassan aiba oosokka oottoppite.

English_Sentences: For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aissi giikko, usuppun gallassaa giddon GODAI salota, sa7aa, abbaanne eta giddon de7iya ubbaa medhdhiis; shin laappuntta gallassan shemppiis. Hegaa gishshau, GODAI Sambbata gallassaa anjjiisinne geeshshiis.

English_Sentences: Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "GODAI ne Xoossai neeyyo immiyo biittan ne baree aduqqana mala, ne aawaanne ne aayyiyo bonchcha.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not kill.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asa woroppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "SHaaramuxoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not steal.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Wuuqqoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ne shooruwaa bollan wordduwaa markkattoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ne shooruwaa keettaa amottoppa; ne shooruwaa keettaayyiyo, woikko a ashkkaraa, woikko a ashkkariyo, woikko a booraa, woikko a hariyaa, woikko ayyo de7iyaabaa aibanne amottoppa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And all the people saw the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the noise of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they removed, and stood afar off.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Asai ubbai dadai xuuqqiyoogaanne wolqqanttai wolqqammiyoogaa be7iis; malkkataa waasuwaa siyiis; qassi deree cuwattiyoogaakka be7iis; be7idi asai yashshaa kokkoriiddi, haahuwan eqqiis.

English_Sentences: And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear: but let not God speak with us, lest we die.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Muusa, "Neeni nuuyyo haasaya; nuuni siyana; shin nuuni haiqqennaadan, Xoossai nuuyyo haasayoppo" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before your faces, that ye sin not.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee asaa, "Xoossai inttena paaccanau, nagaraa intte oottenna mala, a yashshai intte wozanan de7anaadan, i yiido gishshau yayyoppite" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Asai haakkidi eqqidaashin, Xoossai de7iyoosaa sikkida xumaakko Muusee shiiqiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, GODAI Muusa, "Israa7eela asaayyo hagaadan yaagada yoota; Taani saluwaappe intteyyo haasayidoogaa intte intte huuphen be7ideta.

English_Sentences: Ye shall not make with me gods of silver, neither shall ye make unto you gods of gold.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ta matan ai eeqanne oottoppite; bira eeqa woikko worqqa eeqa intteyyo oottoppite.

English_Sentences: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings, and thy peace offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in all places where I record my name I will come unto thee, and I will bless thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni taayyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa urqqaappe medhdha; medhdhada ne xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa, ne atotettaa yarshshuwaa, ne dorssatanne ne boorata a bolli yarshsha. Ta sunttai hassayettana mala, taani oottiyo soho ubban neekko yaada, nena anjjana.

English_Sentences: And if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stone: for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni taayyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa shuchchaappe keexxikko, masettida shuchchaappe keexxoppa; aissi giikko, neeni massiyo miishshan a bochchikko, ne a tunissaasa.

English_Sentences: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy nakedness be not discovered thereon.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ta yarshsho sohuwaa pude gayyiyan kiyiyoogaa keena xoqqan gimbboppa; aissi giikko, neeni kiyiyo wode, ne kalloi beettana yaagada yoota.

English_Sentences: Now these are the judgments which thou shalt set before them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Neeni etayyo immana higgee hagaa.

English_Sentences: If thou buy an Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni Ibraawe ailliyaa shammikko, i neeyyo usuppun laittaa ootto; shin laappuntta laitti i ainne qanxxennan, ailletettaappe coo kiyidi bo.

English_Sentences: If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he were married, then his wife shall go out with him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I barkka yiidabaa gidikko barkka bo; ba keettaayeera yiidabaa gidikko, a keettaayyiyaakka aara bu.

English_Sentences: If his master have given him a wife, and she have born him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he shall go out by himself.
Wolaitta_Sentences: A godai ayyo machcho immidabaa gidikkonne machchiyaa ayyo attuma naata woikko macca naata yelidabaa gidikko, he maccaasiyaanne i naati a godaabaa; i barkka kiyidi bo.

English_Sentences: And if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free:
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin he aillee, Taani ta godaa, ta keettaayyiyoonne ta naata siiqais; taani ailletettaappe kiyikke yaagikko,

English_Sentences: Then his master shall bring him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or unto the door post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an aul; and he shall serve him for ever.
Wolaitta_Sentences: a godai a pirddiyaageetu sintti aatto; hegaappe guyyiyan pengge woikko pengge qosilettaakko a efiidi, a haittaa goottan lukko. Simmi i ba de7o laitta ubban ayyo aille gidana.

English_Sentences: And if a man sell his daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not go out as the menservants do.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asi ba macca na7iyo ailletettau baizzikko, attuma ailleti ailletettaappe kiyiyoogaadan a kiyuppu.

English_Sentences: If she please not her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a strange nation he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.
Wolaitta_Sentences: A bana dooridi efiida godaa lo77ana xayikko, godai o wozissanau koshshees. I iyyo ammanettibeenna gishshau, o allagau baizzanau ayyo maati baawa.

English_Sentences: And if he have betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I o ba na7aayyo immanau doorikko, macca na7assi bessiyaabaa iyyo ootto.

English_Sentences: If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I baayyo hara maccaasa ekkikko, koiro maccaaseessi i qumau, i maayuwau woikko i inddau bessiyaabaa iyyo pacissoppo.

English_Sentences: And if he do not these three unto her, then shall she go out free without money.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I ha heezzubata iyyo immana xayikko, ainne miishsha qanxxennan ailletettaappe kiyada bu.

English_Sentences: He that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be surely put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asa shocidi woriya asa tumuppe woranau bessees.

English_Sentences: And if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin eriiddi gidennan i woriyo wode, taani, Xoossai co77u giidobaa gidikko, i baqatanasaa intteyyo taani giigissana.

English_Sentences: But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbour, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin asi halchchidi eriiddi hara asa worikko, he aawa ta yarshsho sohuwaappe diggada, hara sohuwan wora.

English_Sentences: And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ba aawaa woikko ba aayyiyo dechchiya uri ooninne tumuppe haiqqo.

English_Sentences: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asa wolqqan oiqqidi baizziya uri woi wolqqan oiqqido asi a kushiyan beettido asi haiqqanau bessees.

English_Sentences: And he that curseth his father, or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ba aawaa woikko ba aayyiyo cayiyaagee haiqqo.

English_Sentences: And if men strive together, and one smite another with a stone, or with his fist, and he die not, but keepeth his bed:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Naa77u asati ooyettikko, issoi hinkkuwaa shuchchan caddikko woikko bubbuxikko, he deshettidaagee haiqqennan attidabaa gidikkonne harggidi hiixan pe7ikko,

English_Sentences: If he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
Wolaitta_Sentences: denddidi guufiyaara kare heeran hemettikko, he dechchidaagee qaxxayettennan attees; gidikkonne i a oosuwaa teqqido gishshau, miishshaa qanxxanaunne a pattanau xallanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: And if a man smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he die under his hand; he shall be surely punished.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asi ba attuma ailliyaa woikko macca ailliyo gatiman shocikkonne hegaa gaasuwan i a kushiyan haiqqikko, shocidaagee qaxxayettanau bessees.

English_Sentences: Notwithstanding, if he continue a day or two, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin he deshettidaagee issi woikko naa77u gallassaara denddikko, he aillee a miishsha gidiyo gishshau, i qaxxayettenna.

English_Sentences: If men strive, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart from her, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely punished, according as the woman's husband will lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Naa77u asati issoi issuwaara warettiiddi abbe ixeta maccaasiyo dechchikkonne a boshettikko, hegaappe hara iita deshetti xayikko, he maccaasee azinai oichchidobaanne daannati pirddidobaa aibanne qanxxo.

English_Sentences: And if any mischief follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin iyyo deshettai darikko, shemppoi haiqqikko shemppo,

English_Sentences: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
Wolaitta_Sentences: aife gishshaa aife, achcha gishshaa achcha, kushe gishshaa kushe, toho gishshaa toho,

English_Sentences: Burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
Wolaitta_Sentences: xuussa gishshaa xuussa, masuntta gishshaa masuntta, qoo7o gishshaa qoo7o ekkanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: And if a man smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, that it perish; he shall let him go free for his eye's sake.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asi ba attuma ailliyaayyo woikko macca ailleeyyo aifiyaa baqqidi toissikko, he aifiyaa gishshau ailletettaappe kessi yeddo.

English_Sentences: And if he smite out his manservant's tooth, or his maidservant's tooth; he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaadankka, ba ailliyaa achchaa woikko ba aillee achchaa menttikko, he achchaa gishshau ailletettaappe kessi yeddo.

English_Sentences: If an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Boori maccaasa woikko attumaasa qaicidi worikko, he boorai shuchchan cadettidi haiqqo; a ashoi meetettoppo. SHin booraa godai qaxxayettoppo.

English_Sentences: But if the ox were wont to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not kept him in, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin boorai kasekka qaiciyo meezee de7iyoogaa gidin, asai a godau yooti wottidaashin, a godai qachchennan ixxin, boorai attuma asa woikko macca asa worikko, he boorai shuchchan cadettidi haiqqo; qassi a godaikka haiqqo.

English_Sentences: If there be laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatsoever is laid upon him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin i gumiyaa qanxxanaadan oishettikko, eti oichchidobaa aibanne qanxxidi, ba shemppuwaa wozo.

English_Sentences: Whether he have gored a son, or have gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Boorai attuma na7a woikko macca na7a qaicidi worikkokka, pirddai issi mala gido.

English_Sentences: If the ox shall push a manservant or a maidservant; he shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Boorai attuma ailliyaa woikko macca ailliyo qaicidi worikko, booraa godai ailliyaa godaassi hasttamu xaqara biraa gumiyaa qanxxo. Boorai shuchchan cadettidi haiqqo.

English_Sentences: And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein;
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asi olla qum77uwaa pogirggikko, woikko olla bookkidi qum77ennan aggikko, boori woikko haree he ollan wullikko,

English_Sentences: The owner of the pit shall make it good, and give money unto the owner of them; and the dead beast shall be his.
Wolaitta_Sentences: he ollaa godai mehiyaa waagaa qanxxo. I a godaassi waagaa qanxxidi, haiqqida mehiyaa bau ekko.

English_Sentences: And if one man's ox hurt another's, that he die; then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the money of it; and the dead ox also they shall divide.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asa boori haraa booraa qaicidi worikko, paxa booraa baizzidi, a waagaanne haiqqida booraa likkiyan shaakki ekkona.

English_Sentences: Or if it be known that the ox hath used to push in time past, and his owner hath not kept him in; he shall surely pay ox for ox; and the dead shall be his own.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin he boorai qaiciyaagaa gidiyoogee kaseti erettishin, a godai a qachchennan aggidabaa gidikko, a godai boora qanxxo. Qanxxidi he haiqqidaagaa bau ekko.

English_Sentences: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asi boora woikko dorssa wuuqqidi shukkikko, woikko baizzikko, booraa gishshaa ichchashu boorata, dorssaa gishshaa oiddu dorssata qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Kaisoi keetta bookkiiddi ohettikkonne shocettidi haiqqikko, shocidaagee suuttaa gussidoogau oishettenna.

English_Sentences: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin hegee xalqqee doliichchin hanikko, i he gukkida suuttaa acuwan oishettees. Kaisoi ba wuuqqidobaa zaaro; shin ayyo aibakko xayikko, ba wuuqqidobaa zaaranau i baizetto.

English_Sentences: If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I wuuqqido mehee paxa de7iiddi a kushen beettikko, boora, woikko hare, woikko dorssa gidikkokka, i ba wuuqqidoogaa naa77u kushe aattidi qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man's field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
Wolaitta_Sentences: asi ba mehiyaa dembban woikko woiniyaa turaa giddon heemmishin, mehee shunchchidi hara asa shooqaappe miikko, i ba shooqaappe woikko ba woiniyaa turaappe ubbaappe lo77iyaabaa afilaamaa qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xaragi denddidi agunttaa buuraara laa7idi, dooriyan de7iya kattaa, woikko equwan de7iya kattaa, woikko goshshaa muleera miyaabaa gidikko, koiro xaragaa oittida bitanee afilaamaa qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man's house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asi biraa woikko hara miishshaa naagissanau ba shooruwaassi hadara immidaashin, shooruwaa sooppe he miishshai wuuqettikkonne kaisoi ohettikko, kaisoi he miishshaayyo naa77u kushe aattidi qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour's goods.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin kaisoi beettennan xayikko, keettaa godai pirddiyaageetukko shiiqo; shiiqidi ba shooruwaa miishshaa bolli ba kushiyaa wottibeennaagau caaqqo.

English_Sentences: For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asi ai mootuwankka, boora gaasuwan, woikko hare gaasuwan, woikko dorssa gaasuwan, woikko maayo gaasuwan, woikko hara bayidabaa gaasuwan, Hagee tabaa giidi mootettikko, naa77u baggaikka bantta mootuwaa pirddiyaageetu sintti aattona; pirddiyaageeti mooranchcha giido uri ba shooruwaayyo naa77u kushe aattidi qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asi ba shoorossi hare, woikko boora, woikko dorssa, woikko hara mehe naagissanau hadara immin haiqqikko, woikko deshettikko, woikko ooninne be7ennan ambbaanoi efiikko,

English_Sentences: Then shall an oath of the LORD be between them both, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbour's goods; and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.
Wolaitta_Sentences: hadaraawai ba shooruwaa mehiyaa bolli ba kushiyaa wottibeennaagau GODAA sinttan caaqqin, eta giddon de7iya yohoi mahettees. He mehiyaa godai caaquwaa ekko; qanxxo immanau koshshenna.

English_Sentences: And if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin mehee shooruwaappe wuuqettidabaa gidikko, keettaawaayyo qanxxo.

English_Sentences: If it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He mehiyaa do7i mentterettidi miidobaa gidikko, markka gidanaadan do7ai miishin attidabaappe ekki eho; yaatidi meqerettida mehiyaa gishshaa qanxxoppo.

English_Sentences: And if a man borrow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Asi ba shooroppe mehe garxxikkonne a godai bainnasan he mehee deshettikko woikko haiqqikko, he mehiyaa qanxxo.

English_Sentences: But if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin a godai aara de7ikko, garxxidaagee qanxxoppo; kerau ekkidobaa gidikko, kerau qanxxiyo miishshai acuwaa qanxxiis.

English_Sentences: And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Issi asi azinau giigabeenna geela7iyo cimmidi, iira zin77iyaabaa gidikko, o cilooshidi baayyo machcho ootto.

English_Sentences: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I aawai o ayyo immanau kebidi ixxikko, geela7iyo ekkiya urai cilooshiyoogaa keena biraa i aawaayyo immo.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Bitiya mishiriyo paxa wottoppa.

English_Sentences: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Meheera zin77iya ooninne haiqqo.

English_Sentences: He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto the LORD only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "GODAA xalaalaayyoppe attin, hara xoossaassi yarshshiya ooninne muleera xayo.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Betidi yiida asa qohoppite woikko un77oppite; aissi giikko, inttekka Gibxxe biittan bete gididi de7ideta.

English_Sentences: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Azinai haiqqido am77iyoonne aawai haiqqido hiyyeesaa un77oppite.

English_Sentences: If thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte eta un77in, eti taakko waassikko,

English_Sentences: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani eta waasuwaa tumuppe siyana; he wode ta hanqqoi intte bolli denddana; taani inttena bisuwan wurssana; intte keettaayeti am77e intte naatikka aawu bainnaageeta gidana.

English_Sentences: If thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Intte giddon de7iya ta asaappe issi hiyyeesau miishsha tal77ikko, miishsha dichchau immiya asadan hanoppite; neeni dichchaa a oichchoppa.

English_Sentences: If thou at all take thy neighbour's raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni issibaa gishshau ne laggiyaa maayuwaa oiqqikko, awai wullennan de7ishin ayyo zaara;

English_Sentences: For that is his covering only, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
Wolaitta_Sentences: aissi giikko, i ba bollaa kammiyoogee hinni xalaalaana; harabaa ai maayidi aqanau danddayii? I taayyo waassikko, taani qarettiyaagaa gidiyo gishshau, siyana.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xoossaa bolli cashsha qaalaa haasayoppa, woikko ne deriyaa haariyaagaa qanggoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne kattaa xeeraappenne ne woiniyaa gum77ettaa kumettaappe taayyo yarshshuwaa shiishsha. "Neeni ne attuma naatu giddon bairatiya na7aa taayyo immanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Miizzaappekka dorssaappekka hegaadan ootta. Eti laappun gallassai gakkanaashin, bantta aayetuura aayetuura takkona; hosppuntta gallassi eta taayyo imma.

English_Sentences: And ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Intte taayyo geeshsha asa gidanau koshshees; hegaa gishshau, bazzo do7ai mentterettidi worido mehiyaa ashuwaa mooppite; hegaa kanau olite.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Worddo odo puukkoppa; worddo markka gidada, iita asa maaddoppa.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Iitabaa oottanau daro asaa kaalloppa; pirddaa geellayanau daro asaara maayada markkattoppa.

English_Sentences: Neither shalt thou countenance a poor man in his cause.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hiyyeesai pirddau shiiqikko, mootuwan a metuwaa xeellada maaddoppa.

English_Sentences: If thou meet thine enemy's ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ne morkkiyaa boori woikko haree bayidaagaa demmikko, zaarada ayyo efa.

English_Sentences: If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt surely help with him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Nena ixxiya bitaniyaa haree caanaara wullidaashin be7ikko, hegan aggaagoppa; maaddada aara dentta.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Pirddaa dabaaban maaddada, ne hiyyeesa asaa pirddaa geellayoppa.

English_Sentences: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oonanne malttiyan mootoppa; geeshshaa woikko xilluwaa woroppa; aissi giikko, dabaa oottidaagaa taani saro yeddikke.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Mattaayiyaa ekkoppa; aissi giikko, mattaayee xeelliyaageetu aifiyaa qooqisseesinne xillotu qaalaa mirqqees.

English_Sentences: Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Betiyaa naaqqoppite; bete gidiyoogee aiba azzanttiyaabaakko ereeta; aissi giikko, intte intte huuphen bete gididi Gibxxe biittan de7ideta.

English_Sentences: And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the fruits thereof:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Neeni ne gadiyaa usuppun laittau goyada, zerada kattaa cakka ekka.

English_Sentences: But the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Laappuntta laitti gadiyaa goyyennan shaachcha; yaatikko, ne asaa giddon de7iya hiyyeesati hegaappe miyoobaa demmana; qassi etappe attiyaagaa do7ati maana. Neeni ne woiniyaa turaakka ne wogaraakka hegaadan ootta.

English_Sentences: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Usuppun gallassaa ne oosuwaa ootta; ne boorainne ne haree shemppana malanne ne son yelettida ailleenne betee, gazddana mala, laappuntta gallassi ooso oottoppa.

English_Sentences: And in all things that I have said unto you be circumspect: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Taani inttena giidobaa ubbaa minttidi oottite; hara xoossatu sunttaa xeesoppite; intte inxxarssaappe hegee siyettoppo.

English_Sentences: Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Laittan heezzutoo intte taayyo baalaa bonchchite.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib; for in it thou camest out from Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty:)
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oittaa Baalaa bonchchite; taani inttena azazidoogaadan, laappun gallassaa irshsuwaa yeggibeenna oittaa miite; intte Abiiba giyo aginan keerido gallassan ha baalaa bonchchite; aissi giikko, intte Gibxxeppe kiyidoi he aginaana. "Intteppe issi asinne ta sinttan mela kushe beettoppo.

English_Sentences: And the feast of harvest, the firstfruits of thy labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the field.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Qassi intte intte gaden zerin, koiro gakkida kattaa cakkiyo wode, Kattaa Cakkiyo Baalaa bonchchite. "Qassikka laittaa wurssettan, kattaa aifiyaa gadeppe shiishshiyo wode, SHiishuwaa Baalaa bonchchite.

English_Sentences: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the LORD God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Attumaasai ubbai Ubbaa Haariya GODAA sinttan laittan heezzutoo beetto.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Neeni yarshshuwaa suuttaa taayyo shiishshaidda, irshshuwaa yeggidi uukkido oittaara shiishshoppa. Ta baalaa bonchchiyo gallassi yarshshettida modhdhuwaappe maalladossi aibinne attoppo.

English_Sentences: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne gaden baira kaxxida kattaappe ubbaappe lo77iyaagaa GODAA soo, ne Xoossaa soo eha. Deeshsha maraa a aayee maattan doissoppa.

English_Sentences: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Ne ogiyan nena naagana malanne taani neeyyo giigissido sohuwaa nena efaana mala, taani kiitanchchaa ne sinttau kiittana.

English_Sentences: Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I yootiyoobaa ezggada ayyo azazetta; a bolli makkaloppa; ta sunttai a bolli de7iyo gishshau, intte nagara oottiyaabaa gidikko, intteyyo i atto geenna.

English_Sentences: But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I yootiyoobaa intte minttidi ezggikkonne taani yootiyoobaa ubbaa oottikko, intte morkketa ubbaa taani morkkana; inttenaara eqettiyaageetuura taanikka eqettana.

English_Sentences: For mine Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites: and I will cut them off.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ta kiitanchchai intteppe sinttau biidi, inttena Amooretu biittaa, Hiitetu biittaa, Parzzetu biittaa, Kanaanetu biittaa, Hiiwetu biittaanne Yaabuusatu biittaa ehaana. Taani eta muleera xaissana.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eta xoossatu sinttan hokkoppite, woikko goinnoppite, woikko eta hanuwaa qulloppite. Intte eta xaissanaunne eta eeqa shuchchata mentterettanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: And ye shall serve the LORD your God, and he shall bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAASSI, intte Xoossaassi, goinnite; yaatikko, i intte kattaanne intte haattaa anjjana; taani harggiyaa intte giddoppe diggana.

English_Sentences: There shall nothing cast their young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte biittan ai maccaasinne boshettenna; mainenna. Taani intte de7ana laittaa qoodaa kunttana.

English_Sentences: I will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Taani ta yashshaa intte sinttau yeddana; inttenaara gaittiya kawotetta ubbaa daganttana; intte morkketi ubbai intteyyo zokkuwaa zaaridi, baqatanaadan taani oottana.

English_Sentences: And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani intteppe sinttau kashiyaa yeddana; yeddada Hiiweta, Kanaanetanne Hiiteta intte sinttaappe laaggada kessana.

English_Sentences: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year; lest the land become desolate, and the beast of the field multiply against thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin biittai mela attennaadaaninne bazzo do7ai inttena waissennaadan, issi laittan eta gooddikke.

English_Sentences: By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin intte qoodan daridi, he biittaa laattana gakkanaassi, taani eta guuttaa guuttaa laaggada kessana.

English_Sentences: And I will set thy bounds from the Red sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the river: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani intte zawaa Zo7o Abbaappe Pilisxxeema Abbaa, bazzuwaappe Efiraaxiisa SHaafaa gattana. He biittan de7iya ubbaa taani intte kushiyan aattada immana; inttekka eta intte sinttappe laaggidi kessana.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Etaara woikko eta xoossatuura maachcha wottoppite.

English_Sentences: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eta intte biittan wottoppite; hinkkoode eti inttena ta bolli nagaraa ootissana; aissi giikko, eta xoossatussi goinniyoogee tumuppe intteyyo pire gidana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto the LORD, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa, "Neeni, Aarooni, Nadaabi Abiihinne Israa7eelappe laappun tammu asaa halaqati GODAAKKO deriyaa huuphiyaa pude kiyite; kiyidi haahuwan goinnite.

English_Sentences: And Moses alone shall come near the LORD: but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee, neeni nerkka taakko shiiqa; harati ta mati yooppona. Qassi asaikka nenaara pude kiyoppo" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we do.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee yiidi, GODAA qaala ubbaanne a wogaa ubbaa asaayyo yootiis; yootin asai ubbai issi qaalan, "GODAI yootidobaa ubbaa nuuni oottana" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee GODAI yootidobaa ubbaa xaafiis. Wonttetta gallassi maallado guuran denddidi, deriyaa xaphuwan yarshshiyoosaa gimbbiis. Gimbbidi Israa7eela asaa yaraa tammanne naa77aa sunttan, tammanne naa77u shuchchaa tuussaa essiis.

English_Sentences: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the LORD.
Wolaitta_Sentences: I Israa7eelatuppe yelaga attumaasaa kiittin, eti biidi xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa shiishshidosona; qassi issippetettaa yarshshuwaassi mirggota GODAASSI yarshshidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee suuttaappe baggaa ekkidi keriyan tigiis; attida bagga suuttaa i yarshshiyoosan caccafiis.

English_Sentences: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Maachchaa Maxaafaa ekkidi, asaassi nabbabiis; nabbabin eti, "GODAI yootidobaa ubbaa nuuni oottana; nuuni azazettana" yaagidosona.

English_Sentences: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee he suuttaa ekkidi, asaa bolli caccafidi eta, "Be7ite, GODAI ha qaala ubban inttenaara wottido maachchaa suuttai hagaa" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee, Aarooni, Nadaabi, Abiihinne Israa7eela cimatuppe laappun tammai pude kiyidosona.

English_Sentences: And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kiyidi Israa7eela Xoossaa be7idosona; a tohuwaappe garssaara saluwaadan geeyida sampperiyaa giyo phooliya shuchchaappe oosettidabaa milatiya wuige malabai de7ees.

English_Sentences: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Xoossai Israa7eela asaa halaqata woribeenna. Eti Xoossaa be7idosona; a sinttan miidosonanne uyidosona.

English_Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Neeni taakko deriyaa pude haaya; haa taakko kiyada, hagan takka; yaatobare neeni eta tamaarissana mala, taani higgiyaanne azazuwaa xaafido masettida shuchchaa neeyyo immana" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee ba ashkkaraa Yaasuura baanau denddiis; Muusee Xoossaa deriyaa pude kiyiis.

English_Sentences: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israa7eela asaa halaqata i, "Nuuni inttekko simmanaashin hagan de7ishshite; Aarooninne Huuri hagan inttenaara de7oosona; yohoi de7iyo ooninne etakko bo" yaagiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee deriyaa pude kiyido wode, shaarai deriyaa kammiis.

English_Sentences: And the glory of the LORD abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi GODAA bonchchoi Siinaa Deriyaa bollan uttiis; he shaarai usuppun gallassaa maayiis; laappuntta gallassan he shaaraa giddoppe GODAI Muusa xeesiis.

English_Sentences: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israa7eelatuyyo GODAA bonchchoi deriyaa huuphiyan xuuggiya tama malatidi beettiis.

English_Sentences: And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee he shaaraa giddo gelidi, deriyaa pude kiyiis; kiyidi deriyaa huuphiyan oitamu gallassaanne oitamu qammaa takkiis.

English_Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muuseyyo hagaadan yaagiis;

English_Sentences: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring me an offering: of every man that giveth it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Taayyo immiyoobaa ehaanaadan neeni Israa7eelatuyyo yoota; taayyo immanau a wozanai a imma imma giyo asa ubbaa imotaa neeni taayyo ekka.

English_Sentences: And this is the offering which ye shall take of them; gold, and silver, and brass,
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte etappe ekkana imotai hagaa: worqqaa, biraa, nahaasiyaa birataa,

English_Sentences: And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,
Wolaitta_Sentences: salo milatiya qacinaa, ochchaa teeraa milatiya qacinaa, shololla zo7o qacinaanne liiqo liinuwaa, deeshshaa agoziyaa,

English_Sentences: And rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
Wolaitta_Sentences: dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogaa, irppaniyaa, guuganttaa,

English_Sentences: Oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for sweet incense,
Wolaitta_Sentences: xomppiyaassi wogaraa zaitiyaa, tiyettiyo zaitiyaanne ixaanaa sawettiya qimamiyaa;

English_Sentences: Onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod, and in the breastplate.
Wolaitta_Sentences: eefuudiyaaninne tiran wottiyoogan yeggiyo maragidiyaa geetettiya shuchchatanne hara phooliya al77o shuchchata eho.

English_Sentences: And let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Yaatidi taani eta giddon aqanaadan, eti taayyo goinniyo sohuwaa giigissona.

English_Sentences: According to all that I shew thee, after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Likke taani nena bessana leemisuwaadan Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaanne a giddon de7iya miishshata oottite.

English_Sentences: And they shall make an ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Eti guuganttaa mittaappe zananai naa77u waranne baggaa, gomppai issi waranne baggaa, geesai qassi issi waranne baggaa gidiya Taabootaa medhdhona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round about.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Suwaanne kariyaa walahi bainna worqqan sheeshsha; a yuushuwaakka worqqa tigettan yuushsha aatta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in the four corners thereof; and two rings shall be in the one side of it, and two rings in the other side of it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He Taabootaayyo oiddu worqqa sagaayota tiga; tigada oiddu gedetun issi baggaara naa77u sagaayota, qassi hankko baggaara naa77u sagaayota aatta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan guuganttaappe kasota kessa; kessada worqqan sheeshsha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, that the ark may be borne with them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taabootaa tookkanau, Taabootaa miyyiyan de7iya sagaayotun kasota aatta.

English_Sentences: The staves shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Tookkiyo kasoti Taabootaa sagaayotu giddon de7ona; eti hegaappe mulekka kiyoppona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taabootaa giddon taani neeyyo immiyo, tammu azazoti xaafetti uttido naa77u masettida shuchchata wotta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make a mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Walahi bainna worqqaappe naa77u waranne baggaa aduqqiya, issi waranne baggaa aakkiya atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make two cherubims of gold, of beaten work shalt thou make them, in the two ends of the mercy seat.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qum77uwaayyo wurssetta naa77u bagga gaxan naa77u kiruubeta, qoxettida worqqaappe medhdha.

English_Sentences: And make one cherub on the one end, and the other cherub on the other end: even of the mercy seat shall ye make the cherubims on the two ends thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issi kiruubiyaa issi bagga gaxan, naa77antto kiruubiyaa hankko bagga gaxan naa77aakka qum77uwaara gatta oittada medhdha.

English_Sentences: And the cherubims shall stretch forth their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, and their faces shall look one to another; toward the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubims be.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kiruubeti bantta qefiyaa denttidi, atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa bantta qefiyan kuwayi wottona; qassi issoi issuwaakko simmi uttidi, qum77uwaa xeellona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt put the mercy seat above upon the ark; and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qum77uwaa Taabootaayyo bolla baggan wotta; qassi taani neeyyo immiyo azazoti xaafettido masettida shuchchata Taabootaa giddon wotta.

English_Sentences: And there I will meet with thee, and I will commune with thee from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubims which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the children of Israel.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Maachchaa Taabootaa bolla qum77uwaa bolli de7iya naa77u kiruubetuppe gidduwan taani nenaara gaittana; gaittada Israa7eela asaayyo taani immiyo azazo ubbaa yan neeyyo immana.

English_Sentences: Thou shalt also make a table of shittim wood: two cubits shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Guuganttaa mittaappe zananai naa77u wara, gomppai issi wara, geesai qassi issi waranne bagga gidiyo issi xaraphpheezaa medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaatada walahi bainna worqqan sheeshsha; qassi a yuushuwan worqqaa tigettaa yuushsha aatta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make unto it a border of an hand breadth round about, and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi gomppai takkaaro gidiya shaashiyaa a bolli yuushsha aatta. Yaatada a bolli worqqa tigettaa yuushsha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He xaraphpheezaayyo oiddu worqqa sagaayota medhdhada, xaraphpheezaa tohoti de7iyo oiddu zoozetun oitta.

English_Sentences: Over against the border shall the rings be for places of the staves to bear the table.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xaraphpheezaa tookkanau kasota aattiyo sagaayoti xaraphpheezau shaashiyaa lanqqiyan shiiqidi de7ona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He tookkiyo kasota guuganttaappe kessada, worqqan eta sheeshsha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the dishes thereof, and spoons thereof, and covers thereof, and bowls thereof, to cover withal: of pure gold shalt thou make them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi sainetanne cilppata, yarshshuwaa yarshshiyo wode go7ettiyo duuqqiyoobatanne xuu7ata walahi bainna worqqaappe ootta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt set upon the table shewbread before me alway.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ta sintti aattiyo geeshsha oittai ubba wodekka xaraphpheezaa bolli xayoppo.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work shall the candlestick be made: his shaft, and his branches, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, shall be of the same.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaa qoxettida walahi bainna worqqaappe ootta; he ballai eqqiyo gedeekka, qassi giddo toomaikka ubbai qoxettida worqqaappe oosettanau koshshees. A qururuusoti, a kukkumotinne a ciishshati ubbai aara issippe oiqetti merettanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: And six branches shall come out of the sides of it; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Miyyiyaara usuppun marati ayyo kiyona; maratuppe heezzati issi baggaara, qassi heezzati hankko baggaara de7ona.

English_Sentences: Three bowls made like unto almonds, with a knop and a flower in one branch; and three bowls made like almonds in the other branch, with a knop and a flower: so in the six branches that come out of the candlestick.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Usuppun maratussikka huuphiyan huuphiyan issi issi kukkumoinne ciishshai de7iyo lauziyaa ciishshaa milatiya wanccai de7o.

English_Sentences: And in the candlestick shall be four bowls made like unto almonds, with their knops and their flowers.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaassi giddo toomai, kukkumotinne ciishshati de7iyo lauziyaa ciishshaa milatiya oiddu wanccan alleeqetto.

English_Sentences: And there shall be a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches that proceed out of the candlestick.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Naa77ai naa77ai issippe waattan de7iyo heezzu maratuppe garssaara issi issi kukkumoi de7o.

English_Sentences: Their knops and their branches shall be of the same: all it shall be one beaten work of pure gold.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kukkumotinne marati ubbai xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaara issippe, oiqetti issuwaa gididi, walahi bainna worqqaappe qoxettidi oosettona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the seven lamps thereof: and they shall light the lamps thereof, that they may give light over against it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Hegaappe guyyiyan xomppiyaa wottiyo ballau laappun xomppeta giigissada, eti sinttaa poo7ana mala xoqqu oottada wotta.

English_Sentences: And the tongs thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, shall be of pure gold.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xomppiyaa toissiyo qaphetanne eta wottiyoobata walahi bainna worqqaappe ootta.

English_Sentences: Of a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xomppiyaa wottiyo ballainne an go7ettiyo miishsha ubbai hasttamanne ichchashu kilo giraame gidiya walahi bainna worqqaappe oosettona.

English_Sentences: And look that thou make them after their pattern, which was shewed thee in the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Akeeka; taani nena deriyaa huuphiyan bessido leemisuwaa kaallada ootta.

English_Sentences: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work shalt thou make them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Qassi liiqo liinuwaappenne salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappe dadettida tammu magalashotuppe Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa giigissa. He magalashotu bolli bollaara issi hiillan kiruubetu misiliyaa sikissa.

English_Sentences: The length of one curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and every one of the curtains shall have one measure.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Magalashoti ubbai issi likke gidona; geesai laatamanne hosppun wara; gomppai oiddu wara gido.

English_Sentences: The five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ichchashu magalashota issippe gattada sikka; hankko attida ichchashu magalashotakka etadan ootta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the uttermost edge of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issippe gaittidi sikettida magalashotuppe issi magalashuwaassi wurssetta gaxan salo milatiya carqqiyaappe siireta medhdha; qassi issippe gaitetti sikettida hankko magalashuwankka hegaadan ootta.

English_Sentences: Fifty loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is in the coupling of the second; that the loops may take hold one of another.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issippe gaittida issi magalashuwaa bolli ishatamu siireta, qassi issippe gaittida hankko magalashuwaa bollikka ishatamu siireta medhdha; he siireti ubbaikka issoi issuwaassi baazzan de7ona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make fifty taches of gold, and couple the curtains together with the taches: and it shall be one tabernacle.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan worqqaappe ishatamu qapheta medhdha; medhdhada Xoossaa Dunkkaanee issuwaa gidana mala, he magalashotu gaxaa gaxaa he qaphetun oitta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make curtains of goats' hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa bollaara kammana mala, tammanne isiini magalashota deeshshaa agoziyaappe daddada, issi dunkkaaniyaa medhdha.

English_Sentences: The length of one curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and the eleven curtains shall be all of one measure.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Tammanne isiini magalashotikka issi likke gidona; issi issi magalashuwaa geesai hasttamu wara, gomppai oiddu wara gido.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tabernacle.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ichchashu magalashota issi baggaara, usuppun magalashota qassi hankko baggaara gattada sikka. Usuppuntta magalashoi dakkotidi, dunkkaaniyaassi sintta baggaara daabuletto.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops in the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gatti sikkido magalashotuppe issi magalashuwaa gaxan ishatamu siireta medhdha; qassi gatti sikkido hankko magalashotuppe wurssetta magalashuwaa gaxan ishatamu siireta medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make fifty taches of brass, and put the taches into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ishatamu nahaasiyaa qapheta medhdhada, siiretu giddo gelissa; yaatada dunkkaaniyaa issippe gatta oitta. Yaatobare ha naa77u oiqettida kamoti issuwaa gidana.

English_Sentences: And the remnant that remaineth of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the backside of the tabernacle.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha dunkkaaniyaa magalashotuppe palahida bagga magalashoi Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaassi guyyessaara woxaletto.

English_Sentences: And a cubit on the one side, and a cubit on the other side of that which remaineth in the length of the curtains of the tent, it shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Dunkkaaniyaa magalashoti naa77u baggaarakka issi issi wara keenaa palahona; he palahidaageeti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa kammana mala, naa77u bagga miyyiyaara woxalettona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering above of badgers' skins.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Dunkkaaniyaa bollaara kammanau dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogaa giigissa; qassi a bollaara kammanau irppaniyaa giigissa.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood standing up.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa xagaagiyoobata sitti giida guuganttaappe kessa.

English_Sentences: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the breadth of one board.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issi issi xagaagiyau geesai tammu wara, gomppai issi waranne bagga gido.

English_Sentences: Two tenons shall there be in one board, set in order one against another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issi issi xagaagiyaassi issuwaa issuwaara gatti oittiya naa77u marata medhdha. Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa xagaageta ubbaakka hegaadan ootta;

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the south side southward.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo tohossa baggaara laatamu xagaageta medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Medhdhada issi issi xagaagiyaayyo naa77u gedeta, muleera oitamu gedeta biraappe giigissa.

English_Sentences: And for the second side of the tabernacle on the north side there shall be twenty boards:
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo huuphessa baggaara, laatamu xagaageta medhdha.

English_Sentences: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Medhdhada issi issi xagaagiyau naa77u gedeti, muleera oitamu gedeti, biraappe giigona.

English_Sentences: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward thou shalt make six boards.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo guyye gaxan arggo baggaara usuppun xagaageta medhdha.

English_Sentences: And two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Medhdhada guyye gaxan de7iya zoozetuyyo naa77u xagaageta giigissa.

English_Sentences: And they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha naa77u zoozetun de7iya xagaageti, xaphuwaappe xeeraa gakkanaashin daabula gididi biidi, xeeran issi migiduwan geli oiqettona; yaatidi naa77ai issuwaa gidona.

English_Sentences: And they shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, issi issi xagaagiyaayyo garssaara naa77u naa77u gedeti de7ona; muleera hosppun xagaagetinne biraappe oosettida tammanne usuppun gedeti de7ona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Qassi guuganttaappe hiraqota kessa. Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo issi bagga miyyiyan de7iya xagaagetussi ichchashu hiraqota,

English_Sentences: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the two sides westward.
Wolaitta_Sentences: qassi hankko bagga miyyiyan de7iya xagaagetussi ichchashu hiraqota giigissa. Hegaadankka, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo guyye arggo baggaara wurssetta gaxan de7iya xagaagetuyyo ichchashu hiraqota medhdha.

English_Sentences: And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall reach from end to end.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Giddo hiraqoi xagaagetussi giddo ginaara ha gaxaappe ya gaxaa gakkanaashin kantti kiyanau koshshees.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars: and thou shalt overlay the bars with gold.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xagaageta worqqan sheeshshada, hiraqoti aadhdhiyo sagaayota worqqaappe medhdha; qassi hiraqotakka worqqan sheeshsha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was shewed thee in the mount.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa taani nena deriyaa bollan bessido leemisuwaadan oottada tokka.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen of cunning work: with cherubims shall it be made:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Salo milatiya, ochchaa teera milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe issi magalashuwaa ootta; he magalashuwaa bolli issi hiillan kiruubetu misiliyaa sikissa.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold: their hooks shall be of gold, upon the four sockets of silver.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaatada worqqan sheeshshido oiddu, mino guuganttaa tuussatun de7iya worqqaappe oosettida kaqqiyoogan kaqqa. He oiddu tuussati biraappe medhdhido tohotun gelona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt hang up the vail under the taches, that thou mayest bring in thither within the vail the ark of the testimony: and the vail shall divide unto you between the holy place and the most holy.
Wolaitta_Sentences: He magalashuwaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa kaaran de7iya qaphetuppe garssaara kaqqada, Maachchaa Taabootaa magalashuwaappe guyye baggan wotta; yaatobare he magalashoi Geeshsha Sohuwaa Ubbaappe Aadhdhida Geeshsha Sohuwaappe shaakkana.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt put the mercy seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa Ubbaappe Aadhdhida Geeshsha Sohuwan de7iya Maachchaa Taabootaa bolli wotta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt set the table without the vail, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and thou shalt put the table on the north side.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xaraphpheezaa magalashuwaappe kareera, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaappe huuphessa baggan wotta; xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaa qassi a ginan tohossa baggaara wotta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make an hanging for the door of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Dunkkaaniyaa geliyo penggiyaassi salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe xilppiyan alleeqissiyaagan oosettida magalashuwaa medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make for the hanging five pillars of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, and their hooks shall be of gold: and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Magalashuwaayyo ichchashu tuussata guuganttaappe kessada, worqqan sheeshsha; kaqqiyoogeetikka worqqaappe oosettidaageeta gidona; tuussatuyyo nahaasiyaa birataappe tigada ichchashu gedeta medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make an altar of shittim wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height thereof shall be three cubits.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Guuganttaappe yarshshiyoosaa keexxa. He yarshshiyoosaayyo geesai heezzu wara gido; gomppainne zananai issi likke, ichchashu ichchashu wara gididi, oiddu zooziyaara de7o.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof: his horns shall be of the same: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oiddu zoozetu wurssetta gaxan gaxan issi issi kaciyaa medhdha; kaceti yarshshiyoosaara issippe oiqettidi oosettona. Yaatada yarshshiyoosaa nahaasiyaa biratan sheeshsha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make his pans to receive his ashes, and his shovels, and his basons, and his fleshhooks, and his firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.
Wolaitta_Sentences: An go7ettiyo miishshata, bidinttaa kessiyo balddeta, akaafata, araciyo kuixaarota, ashuwaa qaphiyo qaphetanne tamaa cooceta ubbaa nahaasiyaa birataappe medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaatada nahaasiyaa birataappe zazzare malabaa medhdha; qassi a oiddu zooziyan oiddu sagaayota medhdha.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaatada yarshshiyoosaayyo duge giddo ginan de7iya dacaa bolli wotta.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make staves for the altar, staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with brass.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Guuganttaappe yarshshiyoosaayyo kasota kessada, nahaasiyaa biratan sheeshsha.

English_Sentences: And the staves shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, to bear it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yarshshiyoosaa tokkiyo wode maaddana mala, he kasota naa77u miyyiyaara de7iya sagaayotun aatta.

English_Sentences: Hollow with boards shalt thou make it: as it was shewed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani nena deriyaa bollan bessidoogaadan, yarshshiyoosaa xaulaappe medhdhidi, gomppaa kofa kessona.

English_Sentences: And thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen of an hundred cubits long for one side:
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo asai shiiqiyo dabaabaa giigissa. Dabaabaayyo tohossa bagga zananai xeetu wara aduqqo; he dabaabaayyo liiqo liinuwaappe dadettida magalashota giigissa.

English_Sentences: And the twenty pillars thereof and their twenty sockets shall be of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ayyo nahaasiyaa birataappe laatamu tuussatanne tuussati eqqiyo laatamu gedeta ootta; eta huuphiyan qassi biraappe kaqqiyoogeetanne tuussata huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeta ootta.

English_Sentences: And likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings of an hundred cubits long, and his twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaadankka, dabaabaayyo huuphessa bagga zananai xeetu waraa aduqqo; qassi laatamu tuussatuuranne he tuussatuyyo laatamu nahaasiyaa gedetuura de7iya magalashoi de7o. Yaatidi biraappe oosettida kaqqiyoogeetinne tuussatu huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo de7ona.

English_Sentences: And for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits: their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Dabaabaayyo arggo bagga gomppai ishatamu waraa aakko; tammu tuussatinne, tuussatuyyo tammu gedeti de7iyo magalashoti ayyo de7ona.

English_Sentences: And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi arshsho bagga dabaabaa gomppaikka ishatamu wara gido.

English_Sentences: The hangings of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Dabaabaa geliyoosaappe issi baggaara tammanne ichchashu wara aduqqiya magalashoti de7ona; etayyo heezzu tuussatinne heezzu gedeti de7ona.

English_Sentences: And on the other side shall be hangings fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaadankka, hinkko baggaara magalashoti tammanne ichchashu wara aduqqiya magalashoti de7ona; etayyo heezzu tuussatinne tuussatuyyo heezzu gedeti de7ona.

English_Sentences: And for the gate of the court shall be an hanging of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needlework: and their pillars shall be four, and their sockets four.
Wolaitta_Sentences: "Dabaabaa geliyoosaayyo laatamu wara aduqqiya magalashuwaa giigissa; hegeekka salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne, shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe dadettidaagaa, xilppiyan alleeqissiyaagan giigissa. Eti an zemppiyo oiddu tuussatanne tuussatuyyo oiddu gedeta giigissa.

English_Sentences: All the pillars round about the court shall be filleted with silver; their hooks shall be of silver, and their sockets of brass.
Wolaitta_Sentences: Dabaabaa yuushuwan de7iya tuussatussi ubbaassi biraappe oosettida qachchiyoogeetinne kaqqiyoogeeti, nahaasiyaappe oosettida gedeti de7ona.

English_Sentences: The length of the court shall be an hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the height five cubits of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.
